1142.content:
“Helloooo? Paging Mrs. Watson!”
Snap! As soon as your fingers clicked together, Candice jolted out of her embarrassed stupor and re entered reality.
After waiting ever so patiently for your new office location, you decided to be a bit more direct with her.
“W-what happened?” She stammered, still at a loss of words while you still had plenty of ammunition to shoot at her.
Deciding not to waste your time humiliating her even more than possible, you simply repeated the question in more blunt terms.
“My new office. It should be logged in to the system now. The system is in that computer. You do still know how to use a computer, right?” You repeated the question in an increasingly patronizing tone.
Narrowing her eyes at you, she bit her lip as she contemplated saying something that would not end well for her before thinking better of it.
Turning back to the keyboard, she entered in a rapid fire combination of keys and pulled up the employee directory on the screen.
“Room 45B. Second floor. Have a nice day, Mr. James,” she told you curtly, before starting to turn back
But you weren’t done just yet.
“You will too, Mrs. Watson. After you do me a small little favor,” you smiled, as she rolled back around begrudgingly to face you.
“Which is?” She scowled resentfully, clearly hating where this is going.
“There should be about five or six clients coming in today to discuss their business with me. I need their contact information and financials on record before they leave. Also, you might’ve been too busy reading People magazine last week to notice but I’ve got a stack of reports to go just itching to be printed at the workroom and taken up to my office. Last but certainly not least, I need a new latte after this one. Whipped cream, soy milk, you know the routine. And I need all this done before noon. I got a schedule to keep. Got it?” You instructed, barely concealing a smug smirk as Candice frantically scribbled her list of tasks down on the back of her hand with a Sharpie.
“Anything else, master?” She grated sarcastically, as you took another sip.
“Put a smile on, Candy. Jeez, make people actually want to talk to you before they do and quickly regret it. But it’s the thought that counts, right?” You smiled, taking one last shot before pushing off the office desk and heading for the spiral staircase.
“You can’t honestly expect me to do all of this in three hours, do you?” She called after you as you twirled around on your heel and leaned in for the punchline.
“Well, I guess you know your role now, huh?” You told her simply, relishing her infuriated seething as you walked towards the spiral staircase.
Feeling rejuvenated with Candice finally humbled, you mentally scratched that accomplishment off your bucket list as you bounded up the stairs with a confident spring in your step.
Reaching the second floor within seconds, you checked your watch nonchalantly as colleagues oblivious to your newfound status brushed past you without so much as an “excuse me.”
“They’ll learn to respect me,” you thought to yourself as you squeezed past a conversation between two apparent college roommates reuniting after a life of mediocrity.
As you rounded that familiar corner and reached the left wing of the floor where your new office was located, you came upon your next victim.
Helena.
She was the office janitor, and not a very good one at that. Your old office was a virtual pig’s sty when she was supposedly making her rounds over there. For the longest time, you never knew why she had such a hate-on for you but in between meeting with clients one day you spotted Candice and Denise talking with her outside the ladies bathroom. Whatever lies those two idiots planted in her hollow skull must’ve stayed in, because she’s been shooting you daggers ever since. And today was no different.
The brunette custodian immediately perked up from her usual sweeping duties as soon as you came around the corner. With her black hair tied in a bun and worn sneakers adorning her feet, she wore an unflattering gray janitor jumpsuit that left much, if any to be desired. Wielding a battered wooden broom with both hands, she had just finished mopping up on the floor, and to her credit it was spotless. Well, for now at least.
“Helena! Funny seeing you up here,” you exclaimed with false enthusiasm.
“Well, I do work here,” she replied dryly, clearly not in the mood to be bothered.
“And it hardly shows,” you smiled in return, giving her a condescending thumbs-up as you surveyed her work.
“Gee thanks, James,” she mumbled, before starting to return to her mopping.
“Don’t mention it. By the way, congrats on being finally allowed to sweep the floors of the upper levels. I guess those extra sessions with Mr. Richards finally did pay off, huh? And I guess its true what they say. One small step for women, one giant leap for gold digging whores,” you taunted mercilessly, watching her facial expression shrivel up in reserved fury.
She was clearly contemplating wiping that arrogant grin off your face with her broom, but thought better of it.
“Don’t you have something important to do or is ‘sexist asshole’ your new job promotion?” She growled angrily.
“Language Helena! Maybe you should speak a little bit more highly of your new boss,” you smirked, brandishing your name tag for good measure.
“I don’t see much,” she shot back, giving you a dirty look.
You probably should’ve let it go by this point, but your newfound power trip was a well-earned one. After years and years of taking their B.S., this was a second chance to get comeuppance on all the feminist bitches who ever tried to keep you down.
“That’s funny coming from you, Helen. I mean, that is some kind of irony that a janitor who probably dropped out of high school is telling the new VP in office that he doesn’t amount to much, don’t you think?”
Rolling her eyes visibly, she begrudgingly started to return to her usual mopping but you were having just too much fun.
Walking past her, you suddenly staggered forward and in a dramatic motion spilled half of your latte on the same floor tiles she had just made immaculate seconds ago.
Feigning surprise with the subtlety of a child actor, you gasped dramatically as the brownish liquid began seeping over the tiles while Helena was absolutely livid seething in your direction.
Visibly incensed at the sight of you purposelessly desecrating her life’s work, she looked liable to hit you with that same broomstick.
“Oops,” you shrugged nonchalantly, quickly dropping the act and sidestepping the growing brownish black puddle.
“So after you finish cleaning that up, I need my office spotless in about twenty minutes for my first client today. Try not to miss anything,” you told her simply, before walking away as if nothing had happened.
Ignoring her not-so-subtle cursing behind you, you fished in your front pocket for your new key as the 45B door plate came into view.
Literally at the door of opportunity, you anxiously inserted the key in and waited for the unlocking mechanism. As soon as you felt the door partially open, you pushed it open and entered your new throne room.
It was everything that you hoped for and then some: a plush couch to the right, a mini-library of office textbooks and your own personal selections, a polished office desk with three chairs for clients and a manager’s chair for yours truly, a water dispenser to the left, a refurbished computer, not to mention a glass window with a bird’s eye view into the parking lot, not to mention plenty of walking room in between.
After years in the making, it was finally official: you had arrived.
Circling around the office desk, you almost openly shed a few tears as your dreams and aspirations finally materialized in the polished wood that you could now run your fingers along. For years you had been told by those feminazi bimbos that you would never reach this pedestal of higher authority, that you didn’t have the testicular fortitude to even try. And now, you did what those morons said you couldn’t, and it felt damn good.
Practically collapsing into the manager’s chair, you heaved a sigh of relief as you dissolved into the hospitable cushion with not a worry in the world.
Staring up at the ceiling fan rotating moderately on its axis, you couldn’t help but let a goofy grin escape your lips as the spinning blades send a refreshing breeze down to greet you.
Placing your latte on a drink coaster, you stretched your fingers expertly before pressing the power button on the monitor and booting the computer system up.
As the screen pulled up, you entered in your username and password before reaching in your pocket and producing a small flash drive, a little bit of an “early birthday present” for yours truly.
Plugging it into the monitor as the home screen materialized, you tapped your fingers patiently on the office desk before the files on the drive commenced its downloading.
Glaring at the multitude of books that adorned your shelves, then at a giant framed portrait of some abstract Picasso painting, you were finally at peace with your work environment.
No putrid smell emitting from the trashcan that Helena “forgot” to take out, no more jealous coworkers trying to leech off your success, no more bad luck.
Now and forever, it was smooth sailing through an ocean of well-earned rest and relaxation.
And nothing could change that.
Knock Knock!
Just as the files finished downloading, a set of knuckles gently banged against your door.
“Come in,” you called, checking your watch to see if the first client had arrived. Not yet that time, you shrugged as the knob turned and the door opened, revealing:
1142.title: “Mind telling me where my new office is? I ha...

choices: No need - you were untouchable now!
You called her back - you'd gone too far!
11421.content:
"Hi it's me...er I mean, it's me - Jacinta!" The reasonably attractive woman gushed, almost tripping over her own feet as she made her way towards you.

You tried not to smirk. Of course, Jacinta. Not the first time that she has babbled around you; it was no secret in the office that good ol' Jaci had long harboured a crush on you. The closest she had ever got to finding the courage to actually ask you out was a few months or so ago - and even that was a pathetic effort! You remembered trying not to laugh in your face as she rambled incoherently on about this new sushi bar in town.

Giving her a flash of your pearly whites, you beckoned her over to a chair opposite you. Checking the time on your Fitbit - it was important to keep in good shape working at an office after all - you stared at her expectantly.

"Well, what is it?" You tried to say without too much impatience. "Like the new office?" You couldn't resist adding.

"Oh James, it's...it's incredible!" She fawned at you, boosting your ego even more. As if you needed that!

Still, she was harmless. She was beneath you - well beneath you. On the hotness scale, she was actually OK - at least a seven out of ten. Yet she did not interest you in the slightest; she was no challenge, had no swagger of sexiness about her. She would be a far too easy lay that would, if anything, tarnish your reputation.

You leaned back and let out a sigh, one you tried to mask with contentment rather than the growing exasperation you were feeling for this hopeless woman. "Yeah, it's pretty great, right? Hey, it's not every day you become Junior Manager..." Allowing those last words to permeate around the room, you noticed Jacinta blush and shyly chew her lip. "Seriously, Jaci. What is it?"

Jacinta let out a nervous giggle before crossing her legs to compose herself. "I, er. Well, Mister James, I'm your new secretary!"

Appreciating her deference to you without even needing the instruction - Mister James had a nice ring to it after all - you smirked. "Oh, so that's why your knickers are in such a twist. I don't blame you honey - I'd be getting equally excited if I got to serve me too!"

Going a deep scarlet, Jacinta averted her eyes from you and stared at the ground. "Yes, well...yes..."

Jeez the things you can get away with when you hold power over a woman AND that you know she has a crush on you!

"Well congratulations. I've got a LOT of work that I need to delegate to you..." You grinned for a moment, remembering the list of tasks you set Candice, knowing that she'd be scrambling around to complete them. "Pen and paper..." You clicked your fingers at her before motioning in a writing fashion for her to snap to attention.

Scrambling up, breathing heavily and fetching a writing pad and a biro, Jacinta stood in front of you while you leaned back and put both feet up casually on your impressive new desk. "Right, first thing's first. I want you to keep an eye on Denise and Candice for me - those two bitch monsters of death. Oh, you'll need to chase up that latte Candy needed to make for me. Next, you're gonna need your own desk in here. Nothing fancy and nothing in direct eyeline of me - no offence. Oh, another thing..."

Jacinta dutifully scribbled down your demands, not showing any sign of complaint whatsoever. This was almost too easy, you mused. With Denise, Candice and even that idiot janitor, Helena, there was some banter, some back-and-forth. Jeez, this dork was no challenge to dominate.

"Anything else, Mister James?" Jacinta said, her eyes wide open and a certain eagerness to please about her that you made you feel both appreciative yet even less respectful of her at the same time.

"Oh, yeah there was one more thing..." You put on a faux-nervous look. "Would you, er, would you...like to go for a drink with me later?"

Jacinta dropped the pen and pad, letting out a couple of frustrated expletives, before jumping back to her feet, a look of bewilderment on her face. "W-what?! A drink...with me...?!"

You maintained the sweet, charming expression before throwing back your head and roaring with laughter "NO! You stupid klutz! You're my secretary. Why in the name of all is good and holy would I want to socialise with you?!" Wiping away a tear of laughter, you sent her away with a flick of your hand, trying not to snigger with the look on her face that ranged from horrified to outraged. "Now, go on - start with finding out where my latte from that idiot Candice has got to!"

As Jacinta ambled away, probably still in shock, you felt a pang of guilt. You had never been rude to her before, not like that. Did having this new power make you get high on making others miserable? Perhaps you had gone too far. You watched Jacinta's heels click away...it wouldn't be too late to call her back, apologise and start afresh with the blonde woman; you are going to be working with her every day in the same office after all...
11421.title: Jacinta, your new secretary

choices: You called her bluff and drank the latte!
You 'accidentally' dropped the drink over Candice - that would teach her!
114211.content:
A feeling of defiance spread through you as you watched her walk away. You are the king now...the king does not apologise to peasants!

No, the only thing that would remotely interest you in Jacinta is her feet...

NO! Cursing yourself, you visibly shake with frustration. Of course - your one weakness, your one achilles heel...

From ever since you can remember, you've had a foot fetish. Growing up, you always found women's feet attractive, whether it was Miss Madison, your Math teacher who would sometimes accidentally drop her heels to the ground, or your high school crush, Michelle, who once in gym class actually planted both bare soles over your face, during a 'self-defence' lesson. You realised as a teenager that you were never going to get girls by being a meek, mild little footlicker. No, you started working out, joined the football team, started dating cheerleaders.

You had convinced yourself back a good decade or so ago, that you did not need feet. True, you had needed to picture Michelle's, Miss Madison or another hot woman's bare feet while fucking a woman, but that was harmless in itself. You were not indulging in your foot fetish. Was it even a foot fetish, if you had never allowed yourself to sniff, kiss and lick feet like all of those others foot losers did? You'd even made a concerted effort to avoid any foot porn online, instead jerking off to women's breasts, asses...you know, the stuff that 'real' men got turned on by...

Standing up and pacing around the room, not only to get in some steps during your day at the office but to shake away all of these unwanted thoughts, you let out a sigh before smiling to yourself.

You were the king....the king bows down to no-one!

Through a combination of relentless hard work, politicking, schmoozing with all of the right people and not allowing for a second your weakness to stray into the work zone, you have been promoted faster than any person in this office's history. You've surpassed the likes of Denise and now she will be bowing to you, as will everyone in this office! One day even Kim - the big boss - will bow down to you! Practising a breathing technique you've learned from your karate classes, you felt immediately more relaxed and at peace as you strolled back over to your desk.

Jacinta reappeared, looking cowed and avoiding eye contact. "Mister James, I...I told Candice...she's bringing the latte in to you...in a moment."

"Good, good," you said casually. Deciding not to berate your new secretary any further, you instead talked her through some of the filing systems until Candice arrived in the room.

"Oh, here he is the Lord Commander of the world," Candice snorted as she walked towards you, styrofoam beverage in hand.

"What a good girl, delivering your superior a nourishing caffeine injection," you retorted, grinning at her patronisingly. "Remember the soy milk, the whipped cream?"

Candice shrugged before turning to Jacinta. "You actually want to work for this guy?"

"Yes, he's...he's a...great boss..." the blonde replied, standing to the side of Candice, keeping her eyes fixed away from you.

"Uh, excuse me...are you as stupid as you look?" You spoke sharply, knowing that you had to dominate Candice quickly before she could sniff a chance at gaining the upper hand. "I asked you a question - soy milk, the cream - you get it?"

Handing you the cup, the brunette receptionist adjusted her glasses before shooting you a dirty look. "Oh, of course I did...Mister James...I would never dare to question you or accidentally spit in your drink..."

You felt your blood boil as you took off the lid and inspected the contents. It was pretty much impossible to tell - with the foam from the soya and the the cream, the bubbles and froth could well have included some of Candice's disgusting saliva...

"You really think I - a lowly, humble receptionist would DARE to do such a thing to a powerful, dominant man like you?! Oh, Mister James, you should really stop doubting yourself and just accept that you've put me in my place now and completely subservient to you...just like good ol' Jaci here..." Candice gave your secretary a sickly-sweet smile before turning back at you, her nose turned up in a definite sneer.

She's fucking with you but how do you deal with this? Knowing that hesitating would only make you look weak, in front of both women, you fixed Candice with a sneer of your own, raising the latte up in the air....
114211.title: Candice's Game

choices: You went after Helena to make her do her job and clean your office!
You ordered Jacinta to do it instead!
1142112.content:
Still holding the latte up in front of you, you grinned before pulling it towards your lips. At the last second, you dramatically lurched forward, crying out in surprise as the cup of coffee slipped from your hands - directly forward onto Candice....

"Fuck...FUCK!" Screamed the brunette receptionist as she staggered backward, her face a picture of abject pain. Jacinta stood transfixed on the spot, giving you a look as if wandering out loud if this were on purpose...

"Don't just stand there Jacinta, get some help! I'll take care of Candice - you get Helena to fix this mess!" Jacinta nods hurriedly before scampering out of the room at once. You tried to disguise your grin at the thought of Helena having to clear up more mess!

"J-James! My skirt...my top...my new shoes....!" Candice wailed, wincing at the feeling of scalding hot coffee soaking through her clothes. "Why did you...?"

"It was an accident," you replied loudly and firmly. Walking around your desk, you grabbed her by the arm and leaned in close, making her eyes widen with fright.

"As far as everyone else around here is concerned, it was an accident. Got it? Only you and I will know that you deserved this, that you dared to threaten me with your disgusting spit in my drink," you seethed at her, tightening your grip so you actually feel some of the latte on your fingers.

"You...you're...sick!" Candice blurted out, her teeth chattering now as she tried in vain to wriggle away from you.

"Listen to me, you little bitch. If you do ANYTHING to defy me, ever again, then I'll do a lot worse than this. A LOT worse! I could end your career, you piece of crap. I've got the power, I've got the authority to make your life hell. Is that what you really want?" You sneered down at her, revelling in how much this woman who was once a nemesis of yours was quickly turning into an afterthought.

Her lips quivering, she blinked back a few tears. "I, I'll t-tell...Denise...K-Kim..."

"Tell your pathetic little friend whatever you want," you spat at her. "And as for Kim - if you seriously think she's gonna take the word of a slutty, cretinous receptionist over the man who she has publicly praised to high heaven...with not a single witness...! Good luck, you fucking idiot!"

"J...Jacinta...she saw..." Candice murmured weakly, now clearly clutching at straws.

"Jacinta works for me!" You scoffed. "She is devoted to me in ways that you will never understand!"

Hearing footsteps approach, you quickly changed your posture to one of a caring, solicitous person. "So, do you think you'll be OK?" You feigned an anxious tone. "You should really go home, get changed and come back in an hour or so. Have a nice hot bath, that will help."

In the corner of your eye, you watched like a hawk the figures of Jacinta and Helena. The Hispanic janitor stood with her hands on her hips, a suspicious look on her face as she studied you and the brunette.

"What the hell happened?" She grunted, causing you to avert your seemingly innocent gaze to her.

Putting on a puzzled expression, you turned to Jacinta. "Jaci - didn't you tell her what happened? That I accidentally tripped and spilt my drink on Candice? It's this new shiny floor, you see. Too clean for it's own good!"

Helena raised an eyebrow and turned to the blonde woman. "Really, that's what happened?"

Jacinta nodded quietly, which you subtly winked at her for in appreciation, unbeknownst to the janitor.

"And you, you ok Miss Candice?"

Sobbing and shaking, the brunette turned away from you, avoiding your gaze and shuffled awkwardly forward. "Yeah...that's what...happened..." She told no-one in particular, keeping her eyes on the ground as she left you office.

Your heart was singing a victory song like no other! Almost tempted to high-five Jacinta, you quickly resisted the urge and gave Helena a smug look. "Ah, well. These things happen. Oopsie - twice in a day I've given you some extra work. Good job that you're such a pro, I guess! Anyway, you were supposed to be here by now anyway," You frowned for a moment as you studied your watch. "Yeah, I told you to make my office spotless, didn't I janitor lady? Right, I'll leave you to it - I feel like getting my OWN coffee!"

The Latina woman stood, her hands still on her hips, and a look of pure hatred adorning her hard yet pretty figures. "Go to hell, gringo."

"Excuse me?" You nearly spluttered, incredulous at this lowly janitor's gall. "Did you just a) refuse your boss's orders and b) use a racial slur against me?"

"You're not my boss," she clicked her tongue at you. "I only answer to boss lady Kim, not a white boy loser like you." Before you could even retort, the janitor turned on her heel and abruptly marched away, her crocs thudding against your shiny new wooden flooring.

"Mister James...that was really an accident...right?" Jacinta's voice snapped you out of your silent, furious trance. How dare that fucking janitor walk away from you....she needed to be put in her place!

Turning to her impatiently you gave her a brief smile. "Course it was. You saw what happened. Accidents happen - you heard it from Candice's own horsey mouth yourself."

Jacinta nodded fervently; it was clear that she was so intimidated by you that it would take very little convincing to keep her as your dutiful little pet. Still, there was the issue of the getting your office cleaned to sort. Your first client - a businesswoman called Stephanie Beachwood - would be here in half an hour...
1142112.title: 'Accidentally' spilling coffee on Candice

choices: You headed straight back to your office - in a foul mood!
You did as Michelle had told you - go and get Kim for her!
11421122.content:
Funnily enough, of all the women to intimidate you in the office, Helena would not be the most obvious thought. The idea of going after her, getting into another verbal spat didn't really appeal. She was so stubborn, so proud - for a cleaner of all roles! Sighing with frustration, you settled for plan b - good ol' Jaci...

"Jacinta, you can clean my office," you told her with authority. "I want it ship-shape, sparkly and clean. Got it?" You fixed her with a look, which was becoming all so natural now.

For a moment, you thought the cute blonde might protest. "Yes, Mister James, no problem. No problem at all!"

Satisfied that you had Jacinta exactly where you wanted her, you gave her a grin before strolling out of your own office, trying your best to ignore the fact that Helena had got one over on you.

Heading straight to the coffee machine, you watched gleefully out of the window as the queen bitch herself, Denise was helping Candice into a cab, a look of both anger and concern on her admittedly attractive face. For a second, your stomach lurched. What if you hadn't sufficiently browbeaten Candice enough? What if Denise attempted to get some revenge on you. Shaking the thought away, you collected your coffee and took a leisurely stroll around the workspace.

So many deadbeats, so much deadwood. You blanked a guy called Jeff who had once been an equal of yours, trying to greet you. An idea popped into your mind, time to see Jenny!

Jenny was the only person remotely close to being called a friend at work. She started after you and perhaps it was in spite of Denise and Candice that you took a liking to her. The redhead was straight-talking but totally apolitical - quite different to you in that regard! She was sweet, kind and always totally supportive of you.

"Hey, Mister James..." She smiled at you, her blue eyes sparkling. "Did you hear what happened to Candice?!"

Something else that you and Jenny shared was a mutual hatred for the bitchy brunette. They worked at different desks but had plenty of opportunities to clash and bicker during the day. Initially, when she started at the office, Denise and Candice tried to make her life hell. They made fun of her dress sense and tried to boss her around. That was not the only reason you befriended her but it did admittedly give you a reason to bond.

"Yeah, I heard that too..." You grinned, checking your fitbit counter. "Oh, nearly a thousand steps already!"

"Hey...!" She giggled. "Don't be all coy. What do you know?!"

For a second you very nearly confide in her, but this was something you wanted NO-ONE to know! "I wish I did...I saw Denise helping her into a cab just now - I nearly died laughing!"

Narrowing her eyes at you, she shrugged. "Hmmm, there's something you're not telling me. I'll get it out of you!"

"Sooo, any word from my client - Stephanie?" You replied, quickly changing the subject. "First meeting in my new office..."

"I'll tell you if you tell me..." Jenny allowed a giggle to escape her lips again.

Realising that this wasn't going anywhere, you sighed but not with too much frustration. Regarding the redhead with fondness, you did appreciate her friendship - it was the only time during the day when you could interact with someone without belittling them if they were a rival or below you, or brownnose if a superior you wanted to gain favour with.

"Jenny, always a pleasure," you smiled, doffing an imaginary cap to her as she cheerily waved you goodbye. Leaving her to her work, you strolled away, sipping on your coffee. The most you give to the worker drones is a mere nod of the head when they tried to greet you. Funny how now, the people who at one point you were on the same level as you, were so far below you; a warm, comforting thought!

Sitting on an office chair, swivelling nonchalantly from side to side is a girl you don't recognise. Very cute, brunette and...barefoot...you can't help but gaze at her, your eyes shifting downwards to one foot idly dangling off the edge of the seat, the other resting on the ground.

"Can I help you?" Her bratty voice rang across the room at you, an intrigued look on her face. FUCK!

It reminded you of girls at school who were too hot to date and would regard you as someone inferior. It made you compelled to reply, rather than just casually nod at her like you did to the other worker ants.

"I'm James - Junior Manager," you added, feeling some of your pride and pomposity return as you walked towards her. "And who are you?"

"Michelle," she replied disinterestedly, not even reacting to your title. "I've been waiting for, like, ages here. Could you go and get the boss, or whoever for me."

For a second you thought that she could be Stephanie Beachwood, which was a ridiculous thought considering her age. This girl was in her early twenties, if that. Plus the name, Michelle, you immediately thought back to your crush at high school. Just a coincidence - Michelle would be older than her anyway!

"Uh, what's up with you?" Michelle rolled her eyes. "I asked you a question and you totally didn't react. What are you, retarded?"

Taken aback by her brattiness and gall, you took a moment to compose yourself. "Look, Michelle, you obviously don't know your place around here. So I'll give you a pass for that. Let me make this clear to you - you're nothing. You're pond scum...at the bottom of the totem pole." Your expression turning into a full smirk, you felt glad to be taking this newbie down a step or two. "What are you, a new assistant? Coffee fetcher?"

"Intern, actually," she retorted, her expression not changing as though unimpressed with your banter. "Now, Jim...John...whatever," she gave a casual wave of her hand. "Either get me the boss or get the hell out of here."

The little shit! You actually allowed yourself to chuckle for a moment, staring at her. Yes she was beautiful but this intern was FAR too cocky for her own good. Who the hell did she think she was?!

"Earth to Jim....!" She clicked her fingers at you, her nose turned up in a sneer. "You're doing that thing again - y'know where you, like, have nothing interesting or clever to say...."

Feeling yourself both intrigued by and despising this smug bitch, you narrowed your eyes at her. For the first time since you could remember, a new member of the office had left you lost for words and was proving impossible to verbally spar with - even more frustrating than Helena!

Words seemed muddled and hard to access; the longer you just stood here, the more embarrassing getting owned by this intern was!

Michelle rolled her eyes again, a victorious look on her face. "Man, you seriously are totally retarded!" She giggled. "I may be at the bottom of this, like, 'totem-pole', but I'm gonna step my way up - and I don't care if that means walking all over losers like you to get there!"

Wiggling her bare toes, you gulped. She couldn't possibly know about your fetish! Yet, if you didn't react now, it woul start getting suspicious with you just staring at this intern while she verbally berated you! Words still not forming, you started to walk away....
11421122.title: A chat with Jenny and meeting Michelle...

choices: You headed towards Jenny at reception even though Denise was there!
You decided to confront Michelle again and this time put her in her place!
114211221.content:
"Bye, Jim!" Michelle's bratty voice was full of smugness as it rang out across the corridor you were walking down.

The little bitch...how dare she...remember the breathing exercises!

When getting a little further away, you actually stopped, bending down a little and wincing with the pain you could feel in your gut. What was that - anger, fear, anxiety, guilt? But why would you be guilty? Calming yourself down enough to think more logically, you could not avoid accepting some simple facts. Michelle was very attractive, she was barefoot, she had beautiful feet and - worst of all - she just OWNED you in a verbal confrontation!

Resuming your trudge back to your office, you were still practically seething with rage as you headed straight to your desk, ignoring Jacinta who was subtly clearing her throat to get your attention.

"It's all done, Mister James...what do you th-think?" She stood in front of you, her eyes shy yet hopeful as you looked up irritably to meet her gaze.

"Yeah...good job..." You murmured, distracted and pretty much oblivious to the fact that your new secretary and actually made a herculean effort to make the entire office new and practically sparkling.

"I...er...anything else, Mister James?" She stood awkwardly, biting her lip, a look of slight concern on her face.

Waving your hand dismissively, you sent her away to check on where Stephanie Beachwood had got to - surely her arrival must've been imminent after all. Trying and failing to get the image of Michelle's pretty toes, wiggling out of your mind, you resumed your karate breathing exercises from before.

...I'm gonna step my way up...I don't care if that means walking over losers like you...

The brat's words echoing inside your head, you suddenly thought of something. A devious smile, flashing across your face, you excitedly jumped up when Jacinta re-entered the room, babbling on about Stephanie not having arrived yet.

"Yeah, yeah," you promptly cut her off. "Anyway, I've got a different task for you - an assignment if you will. I know that you'll ace it for me, won't you Jacinta?"

"Oh, y-yes Mister James!" Jacinta practically cried out in response, her eyes wide and eager all at once.

"OK, there's this new girl - some intern called Michelle - that I want you to keep an eye on..."

Avoiding any details about her feet or the fact that she got one over on you just now obviously, you instructed your secretary to keep an eye on her, find out anything that she could - any details that would give you some leverage on her. Jacinta seemed a bit uncertain about it but still readily agreed. She was your loyal little pet after all!

Feeling better about things, now that you had some sort out plan to deal with this annoyingly hot, barefoot brat, you nailed the meeting with Stephanie. She was clearly impressed with you and seemed set to make a much larger order than even you would have anticipated. Not having another appointment or meeting until the afternoon, you stretched out your legs, sighed contentedly as you sipped on the fresh new latte that Jacinta just bought you.

"Ahhh...well this has been a very successful morning, wouldn't you say Jacinta? You know, things are gonna work out well for you - just keep up this level of dedication and remember to get me some information on that stupid new intern...It'll be all good!"

"Yes, Mister James," Jacinta nodded and smiled.

"I'm gonna go and stretch my legs a little. Get some more steps in..." Cheerily waving a goodbye, you headed out of the office and decided to head towards Jenny at the main reception to fill her in on your successful meeting with Stephanie. Again, you looked through people and barely acknowledged them as you strolled past. You were the king and they were mere peasants beneath you now!

As you approached Jenny, you saw a familiar and, admittedly, hot figure of Denise hovering around. Denise was your absolute nemesis; you truly despised one another! Starting at the company at a similar time, you were both very highly regarded and two of the strongest performers in the entire office. She had always hated and resented how good you were at your job. Yet look at what happened - you got the promotion and she didn't! You won - she lost! A smirk on your face, you began triumphantly sauntering over to her, only to remember the incident with Candice earlier and the look on Denise's face as she was helping her friend into a cab. Was it worth stirring things up, risking Denise making accusations about you deliberately spilling coffee on the brunette in front of people?

In the corner of your eye, you spotted Michelle again. Feeling so buoyed up from your meeting, did you decide that you had the nerve to take her on again in a verbal spat? Or was that asking for trouble?
114211221.title: Back and forth to the office

choices: Fast forward to the end of the shift and check on Denise.
Return to your office and check what Jacinta has found on Michelle.
1142112211.content:
Michelle can wait, you thought. After all, your secretary, Jacinta, has been tasked with getting as much information as possible about her. Risking to go to her right now would end up detrimental for you, if you were to lose another verbal sparring, especially in public with your enemies present.

As such you headed towards Jenny at reception, even though Denise was there! From what you could see they were discussing how unfortunate it was for Candice to have her new outfit and shoes soaked unexpectedly. Jenny spotted you moving to the reception and waved, as a devilish smile was starting to form as she was well aware you knew what had happened.

"James! It's nice seeing you, we were just discussing how unfortunate it was for Candice to have her clothes drenched like that." - Jenny, of course, was playing a role, as she also harboured hatred for Candice.

"Indeed, poor Candice had her dress ruined, it is a shame really, hope that doesn't interfere with her entire workday." - You, faked out a sympathetic smile as you knew full well, that her dress was in its present state.

"Since when did you become so considerate of other people's feelings, James? From what I recall you hate Candice's guts and are, in my book, you spilt that coffee on purpose, rather than to have just tripped. " - Denise's words came off rather sharp, as her face was one of resentment. However, how did she dare to talk to you, the king of the place, like that?

"Denise! It's nice to see that you are doing well, although, could you please tell me where is your alibi that I have spilt the coffee on purpose? All I was trying to say is that I hope that Candice quickly recovers so that the accident doesn't sabotage the rest of her workday." - You had already predicted that you would be accused. Candice had likely spilt the beans on you or has at least said the version you agreed upon in your office.

"Jamesy, you could fool someone else with that. I don't care, what your version of things is, when I find out the truth, you will be begging at my feet and whimper." - Denise answered with a smug, as she was not scared by your attempt to scare her.

Your body felt numb for a moment, as you imagined being at Denise's feet and admiring how better she was, than you. Despite that, you quickly got back to your senses and responded with a witty remark.

"Is that so Deni? Well, good luck with that. In the meanwhile, I hope you don't mind going to run the errands I left for you, I want them done by the end of the shift." - Waving your hand dismissively and pointing to her office as it was towered with documents.

"You, you, you don't expect me to be done by the end of the shift with all of that, right?!" - Denise answered angrily as her hands had already formed fists.

"Of course I am! You are an excellent employee and you wouldn't complain to that workload, right? Or would you want a compromise on your monthly wage?" - You took one final glance at her and refocused your attention on Kim. Denise was not satisfied. Not one bit. She quickly headed back to her office, cursing you under her breath. You had succeeded in pissing not only Candice but Denise as well, which meant two even worse enemies trying to dethrone you.

"I take it that your meeting with Stephanie went well." - Kim remarked after Denise was out of sight. "Either that or you are on fire. Because you burnt Denise alive! - Kim added, to boost your already big ego further.

"What can I say, it is definitely good to finally get back at her after all of the years I had to put up with her." - You boast as you were amused at how well this, at first glance, bad situation seemed.

However, there was something that bothered you. You enjoyed how Denise had told you that she would make you whimper at her feet, it made you feel vulnerable.

Maybe it wouldn't be that bad to give it a shot, right? Maybe check on how she was doing with her work at the end of the shift?

Or maybe you should check up with Jacinta. To see what she has gotten on Michelle so that she doesn't get the upper hand on you, this time in public.

11421122111.content:
A weary yet ultimately satisfied sigh escaped your lips as you walked down the hallway, a confident swagger in your every step.

Unsurprisingly, the shift ends a whole hell of a lot quicker when you’re telling other people to fill out the paperwork, instead of the other way around.

And it’s even better when the person you’re delegating the work to just happens to be your mortal enemy in the world of workplace politics.

Your arch nemesis, your equal in almost every way.

“Well…” Cocking a sly grin as you finally arrive at Denise’s office, you mentally reminded yourself, “Until today.”

Raising your right hand, you gently knocked on the glass door, right next to a polished door plate that listed her full name and current position, aka “not the Junior Manager.”

Stepping back with all the time in the world, you waited patiently as you heard the typical angry clacking of her high heels from the other side.

Already licking your lips in anticipation one second in, the next had your now subordinate opening the door to reveal her beautiful yet almost perpetual bitch face.

“Well it’s about time you got here,” she ‘greeted’ you coldly, crossing her arms together.

Looking at the woman now, head to toe, made you come to quite an obvious realization, one that eluded you in all those years of furiously fighting for the top position: Denise was freakin’ hot as hell.

Standing at an impressive height even with high heels on, every inch of her simply radiated sex appeal.

Dressed in a black blouse with a contrasting white skirt, her arms were well-toned and her midsection was near perfect hourglass.

Denise’s legs, slender and seductive, seemingly extended for miles before finally ending with her sleek black Christian Louboutins pumps, each one almost effortlessly accentuating her feminine arches.

In another universe, you two could’ve totally been a thing.

But perhaps, if she really wants a promotion down the line-

“You gonna just stand there gawking at me, James, like all the other virgin interns around here, or you gonna pick up your damn files?” Denise snapped at you, her irritable voice finally snapping you out of it.

Quickly returning behind your wall of confidence, you shot back at her playfully, “What can I say? You’re a very attractive woman, Demise. And maybe, just maybe, if you weren’t such an unlikable person, someone might actually take pity on you and ask you out.”

Scoffing, she replied scathingly, “Cute.”

Visibly relishing her absolutely delicious bitterness, you nonetheless got back on track. “So...did you do everything I instructed you to do?”

She rolled her eyes. “Yes.”

“Yes what?” you prompted her teasingly.

Almost forcing the next words out of her mouth, she grated at you, “Yes, I did everything you asked of me, James.”

“Good.” Satisfied with her response for now, you brushed past her and entered into the blonde woman's office.

As promised, the mountain of documents and unfinished paperwork was now neatly organized inside a cardboard box on the middle of her desk.

Ignoring her practically sneering at you from behind, your eyes then took a curious detour around her office space.

In many ways, it reminded you of your old office, before you became the true king of the office kingdom.

The size was pretty similar, except with the addition of a few office chairs here and there. She also had a more recent desktop computer, and a vanity shelf full of her various accolades, college diploma, and many Employee of the Month plagues.

She had everything….

“Except my job,” you couldn’t help but smirk to yourself, walking around the desk as she continued watching you with utter disdain.

“In case you were daydreaming back there, I did what you asked. Now, take your shit and get the hell out of my-” Before Denise could finish her sentence, you casually plopped down on her plush office chair and proceeded to put both feet up on her desk.

Her mouth briefly dropped as you reclined back, before a look of pure indignation washed over her face.

“Um….excuse me?!” she snarled at you, barely able to restrain herself.

“Oh, my apologies.” Removing your shoes from the polished wood, you gestured at a nearby chair. “You can have a seat.”

Words alone could not describe the anger and outrage that dominated her facial features at this moment, her raw emotions threatening to come out in a flurry of very choice words from her mouth at any moment.

But, as expected, the blonde reluctantly calmed herself down, and after a deep and somewhat calming breath, sat down on a chair usually reserved for customers and visitors.

“I gotta say, Deni, you really have a good eye for office furniture. After such a long and hard day as Junior Manager, this cushion is really doing wonders for my back,” you tease her, exaggerating a yawn much to her chagrin.

Her lips curled into a venomous sneer as she forcibly formed the words, “If you say so.”

“All kidding aside, I really appreciate you doing this for me, Denise. Shows a lot from you, that after all we’ve been through here, you’re still a team player,” you complimented her patronizingly.

She said nothing in response, a rarity from the usually outspoken blonde.

“You know, I’ve been thinking all day about this...” Resting your elbows on her desk, you absolutely relished the barely concealed rage on her face, her better judgment working overtime to prevent her from doing or saying anything stupid.

Well, stupider than usual, at least.

Unclipping your platinum name tag, you told her candidly, “You and I really did go to war for this, didn’t we? All those years….you and Candace did your damnedest to keep me down. You used every dirty trick in the book, took every low blow you could. I mean Jeez, you guys really did make my life hell around here.”

“You’re welcome,” she finally replied sardonically.

Smirking, you continued on, “But, despite all the shit two threw at me, I kept coming back. If anything, your little schemes actually backfired, because it made me want this-” Brandishing your nametag proudly above the desk for emphasis, you then continued on, “- even more. After everything, it just made me hungrier. More cutthroat. More ambitious. I became the best possible version of myself, really, and eventually, even the higher-ups recognized it.”

You could almost hear her grinding her teeth together angrily.

“I’m grateful for all that,” you finally came around to saying, your moment of self-reflection now complete.

Knowing full well just how much it pissed her off to no end, you then delivered the coup de grace, “Denise, thank you for helping to make me the new Junior Manager.”

Clenching her fists together against her skirt, Denise’s quite visible indignation was quickly offset by her shifting to a more ladylike position, crossing one shapely leg over the other.

“But…” Stopping yourself before you could get anymore sentimental, you then cocked a sly grin, “Just because I appreciate all you’ve done, doesn’t mean I forgot exactly what you two did to me all those years.”

Time for the kill shot.

Leaning forward, you proceeded to deliver something that would be near fatal to someone with an ego like Denise’s. “We’re professionals, and as such, I am more than willing to leave all that baggage in the past. But, to do so, I need you to apologize to me, right here and now.”

“What?” she nearly screamed out, nearly losing her composure at this demeaning request. “First you pull that coffee shit with Candace, now this! Oh James, I don’t know if you’re trying to compensate for something with that little nametag of yours, but-”

“Don’t talk to your boss like that!” you cut her off sternly, no longer smiling. “I’m giving you one chance, only one, to not end up on my permanent shitlist. Look, I’ll make it right with Candace….eventually, but right now, this is about us. This is about us burying the hatchet, and moving the hell on.”

“Now, I want you to….” Out of the corner of your eye, you couldn’t help but notice her now dangling her high heel, granting a fleeting glimpse at her soft, feminine arch before it was clothed once again by the leather.

Her ankle rolling reflexively, she popped her heel out and began dangling yet again, the impatient bobbing up and down reflective of her equally annoyed body language.

Up and down, up and-snap out of it, James!

Finding your mental footing and steering clear of her distracting imagery, you delivered the ultimatum again with noticeably less gusto behind it, “....I want you to apologize.”

“You can’t be serious,” she snorted dismissively, pointing out, “What about Candice’s apology for spilling your Mocha shit all over her clothes?”

“I’ll apologize to Candice when you apologize to me,” you told her firmly, determined to humble this woman even if you have to...even if you have to….

Somehow losing your train of thought, your eyes once again were drawn to the sheer magnetic pull of her expert shoeplay.

Damn, she really knows what she's doi-fuck!

Snapping your head up before fully losing yourself in her womanly arch, you couldn't help but notice a curious glint in Denise's eyes.

Almost immediately, panic flooded your own as you thought to yourself frantically.

Does she know?

11421122112.content:
You tighten up your tie, as a confident smirk appeared on your face and you fixed your posture and headed back to your office, being greeted by your lovely secretary Jacinta. Sadly, you weren't there for her, rather, you were looking for some dirt or information regarding the confident intern which brushed you off so easily earlier. Who was she? She couldn't be this confident without any reason, right?

You didn't get in your position by going with irrational decisions, you knew that preparing and weighing the pros and cons of an action is what pulled you ahead of Denise, that's why you were now the King, while she, she had a pile of work waiting for her as your thoughts crossed you.

"Hey, Jaci, did you find anything on our new intern Michelle?" You said as you put your legs on top of your desk and smiled back at Jacinta, as to catch her off guard.

"Um..y-yes Mister James!" Jacinta's face slowly turned pinkish red as she looked down the files she managed to muster during the time you had your meeting and time it took to put Denise in her place. "She is actually quite the prospect! It seems she had a 5.0 GPA as she took all the possible extracurricular as well as acing bot the SAT 1 and SAT 2!" Even as she read it, Jacinta's expression was one of surprise. Not even Kim herself had gotten a GPA of 5.0 nor did she have a SAT of that calibre.

"Jacinta, did I hear you right?!" You lost balance for a couple of seconds on your desk as you assumed a seated figure four to regain balance. You were in awe! What was she doing here? Your firm was indeed a prestige one, but there must be something else behind her internship here.

"Well Mister James, I have good news!" Jacinta smiled as she hovered over the other page as she had taken her time to research all of the other people in her graduation year. "By the words of the teachers, she wasn't always present to classes and when she was, she did not listen to anything that was said to her. What is more interesting..." - Jacinta flickered to the next page as she placed crossed her legs with her right foot wiggling at you, wearing high heels. You lost track of what she was talking about as you focused on her feet, imagining how nice it would be to have them get close to your face, maybe even lick them, your secretary wouldn't mind, right?

"Mister James?" - Jacinta's tone changed as she started to question if you were still listening to her.

"Oh, yes! Sorry about that Jaci, I am a bit tired from today, I barely got any sleep to prepare for Stephanie." - Slowly coming to your senses, you realized that your eyes had wandered to somewhere they shouldn't have. The good part was that Jacinta didn't catch on to your fetish. " Could you please repeat what you were saying?" - You put your head below your hands, as you fixated your gaze to Jacinta's eyes and listened to her carefully.

"A-as I was sa-saying..." Jacinta blushed more than she previously had as it was her dream to have you pay her your full attention. "What is more interesting is, the people that usually had the highest GPA in all of the subjects in her class as well as the ones that took the extracurricular she did, had a massive dip of performance when tests came. What is even more interesting is she always sat next to them when it was examination time, but, had never previously gotten to them."

Huh? Did you find the secret to it? It was not hard to realize what the possible situation was, however, you had to ponder over it a bit more before deciding on how to proceed.

Despite that, your secretary Jacinta had done an amazing job! You should at least help her out with a raise... or maybe, take her out on the date she has wanted every since you two met eyes in your small cubicles?

114211221121.content:
"So Michelle had the best possible GPA and had aced SAT?" You thought to yourself as you were smoking your Treasurer cigarette and were pondering what to do with her. There was no way she was here by accident, she was put her. That's right.

"Jaci, please tell miss Michelle to come to see me after an hour." You put off your cigar and started looking at the report that Jacinta prepared for you previously.

"Of course Mister James! What do I tell her you are calling her for?" Jacinta was slowly writing into her notebook as a bit of annoyance could be tracked in her voice, as well as the constant tapping on the floor for nervousness.

"Tell her, that Kim said it was best for her to be taught by the best man the firm has to offer so she could quickly progress ahead" Your confidence was still there, your boasting abilities about your skills as well. Both you and Jacinta knew that Kim wouldn't tell an intern to be taught by a Junior Manager like you, she would better put someone like Denise to teach her. Jacinta didn't say a word about it, however, her reply showcased how she felt.

"Of course, Mister James... I will.." Sadness could be picked from Jacinta's voice as she was aware, your intentions were far more than just teaching her.

During the time you had, you dug for all kind of information you could find about Michelle, needless to say, you found it. You weren't Junior Manager for nothing, your abilities to search what was needed were a level above the others in the firm. "Michelle B..." SHE WAS YOUR BIGGEST PARTNER'S DAUGHTER? For a moment you were a bit surprised, however, that would totally make sense, considering her scores from university and her SAT results. It also turned out that she had blackmailed all of the highest scorers to assist her, as you quickly compared the publicly available handwritten exams to how she had written her signing documents. It was a wild guess, but you trusted your guts, that's how you always got the best deals so far during your working career.

As you re-examined the papers you slowly relaxed into your chair and continued to meditate from what you have learned from your Karate classes. If she really did blackmail the people there, it wouldn't be impossible for her to try the same here. You really wish you hadn't asked her to come, however, it was too late to call it off, there were 10 minutes remaining.

"Hello Jim, to what do I owe the pleasure of seeing a loser like you twice in one day?" Those were Michelle's first words as she entered your office, slowly taking her spot opposing to you, taking off her sneakers, leaving her barefoot.

Not looking at her feet was a difficult task, however, thanks to your exercises you were able to hold off looking at them. "Michelle, I would like to apologise for my earlier comments. I looked into your records and I saw your results, you are a protegee that the firm is happy to have!

Pathetic, pathetic, pathetic, pathetic.

Why were you praising a bratty teenager with no experience in the field? Sure, her dad was an important figure but did you really have to suck up to her? You even realized she wasn't addressing you correctly, yet you still didn't correct her this time, why?

"My my, James, is that an apology for your pathetic attempt at "banter" earlier?" - Michelle's bratty voice and the way her face formed a devilish smile across her lips was starting to worry you.

"Yes, I apologise for my previous behaviour. As such, as an apology, I propose an offer to teach you how things work around here, and help you get used to the business field." With a small gulp, you answered to her mocking statement and sucked it up.

Is Michelle satisfied with your proposal?

Or maybe, she has another proposal?

1142112211211.content:
A few moments had passed after your proposal, that by itself worried you, as you were wondering if you were convincing enough, as such you fixed your tie and straightened up your posture to gaze directly into Michelle's eyes, eagerly waiting for a response.

"Teach me how things...work here? That sounds like an interesting offer." Michelle's voice sounded a bit sarcastic, nonetheless, also a bit intrigued. She crossed and uncrossed her legs, getting her feet to a higher, more visible position. Needless to say, it was already starting to get hard for you to focus on the situation.

"That sounds great! We can start tomorrow..." Your voice was one of relief at first, as she finally answered your question, despite that you were quickly and shortly after that interrupted.

"I take it, that you aren't as stupid as I thought." Michelle giggled as she took a glance at the papers, which had her name and her report for her academic years.

SHIT!SHIT!SHIT!

You had totally forgotten that the papers were all around your desk. The worst part was that she could directly see her name as the page in question was turned around for her to read it.

"I suppose, you are also aware who my dad is. The big Mr.B." Michelle continued to talk as she gathered the papers and read through them. Interestingly enough, her face also looked shocked. "I wasn't aware that you could find all of this information about me online, considering I always covered my tracks. I was wrong about you John, you aren't a TOTAL loser." Michelle's words came across as sharp as a razor. The bratty brunette was continuously making fun of you, despite your efforts of digging up all of the information.

"My name is James..." - You attempted to correct her mocking and stand up for yourself, however, you were quickly interrupted for yet another time.

"Yeah, yeah, whatever." Michelle's tone was getting more arrogant by the minute, while she was looking at her nails, completely ignoring that she was sitting in front of you. "My dad sent me to this shit hole for experience, after all, I am his only successor and he wanted me to learn the ropes from a partnered firm.

"I think that's a great decision on his part, we have people with the great amount of experience which can help you.." You tried to regain control of the conversation using your natural selling skills which had helped you get Stephanie.

Pity. You forgot who you were talking to, you were already in the intern's palm. "Your overconfidence really got the best of you, huh James?" You thought to yourself, as you were interrupted for yet another time.

"Jim, be a good boy and don't interrupt mommy while she is speaking, okay?" Michelle's words stung you a bit, you started to feel weak, slowly dropping your guard, as you were staring at the beautiful intern, speechless. "Now, where was I?" Michelle said as she put her feet on top of your desk, while she was pondering what she could ask of you.

That was it. Despite your rigorous and countless attempts to resist them, you were now staring at Michelle's bare soles. They were indeed beautiful, size 5 feet, as her pedicured red toes were wiggling right in front of your face.

"Did you hear what I said?" Michelle questioned you, as she slowly tilted her head, staring you directly in the eyes, as a small smugly smirk was appearing on her face.

"Um..y-you said..." A sudden blush appeared on your face, you were totally caught off guard as your once-dominant position, was now diminished to one resembling your first day at work. Anxious, reserved and self-conscious of the things around you.

"It's okay Mr Junior Manager. I've also done my research on you, how else do you think I got other people to do exams for me? I found their weaknesses, and used them." Michelle stated as she continued giggling, while her right foot slowly got closer to your face, pressing to it, rubbing you for a couple of seconds and slowly pulling it away. "I am aware of your foot fetish, a lot of my professors and colleagues had it as well, which helped me ace my assignments here and there."

"You son of a..." You tried retaliating, however, it was yet another failed attempt as she got her feet closer to your face, forcing you to inhale on her scent, the smelly aroma of her feet which made you stop your sentence, without further questions.

"From here on out, I am your boss, James." Michelle, for once, had addressed you properly, her tone, being more dominant and straight forward than Kim's. "I won't destroy your reputation here in front of your colleagues, as it would indirectly impact my father's firm, having bad partners would speak ill of him. However, when we are alone or if I want anything from you, you answer to me. If Kim asks you to meet her and I call you, you come to me, you won't do anything without my approval, got it?" Michelle ended her sentence with a fixation to the last bit of it.

"Y-Yes, Michelle, I got it." You had already lost. You didn't even attempt on making a witty comeback, as the aroma of her feet had already hypnotized you, rendering you unable to resist.

"Don't worry, I won't take away your salary, however, you are mistaking if you think I will do all the work. From this moment onward, you will be taking my entire workload. I don't care if you or that slutty secretary of yours does it, all I want is to have it done and for it to be done right." Michelle's words were direct commands, she wasn't asking it of you, she was DEMANDING you to do it.

"Did you catch all of that, doggy?" With that Michelle slowly rubbed her bare soles to your face as her bratty tone was like a piercing sound to your ears, to which you could just nod, empty of words at this point.

"Great! Then how about we seal our contract, right here and now? Kiss each of my feet and tell me you want to serve your new mistress." Michelle really wasn't kidding. You could also spot her phone coming out of her jeans as she was waiting for your answer.

"I want Michelle to be my mistress, as well as to help her climb the ladder, as I am but an example!" You could not believe the words you had just uttered, you even overdid it. And as by instinct, you kissed both of her bare soles, followed by you rubbing your face to them.

"And cut! That was amazing doggy, even I couldn't have come up with a more humiliating line for you" Michelle's smile widened as she finished recording the video, as proof of your agreement and for you to be unable to oppose her again.

Moments after she had finished recording, she got her feet off the desk and put them back into her sneakers as she looked overjoyed by how well it had panned out for her. With that she got up and was about to leave your office as she spoke in a soft tone, looking back at you with a smug face.

"It was nice doing business with you, doggy. I guess I already know how things work around here~" With that Michelle winked back at you, as you were left alone in your office.

You were done for, your whole career, your whole life's worth, for you to be domesticated by a petite intern which had exposed your fetish.

How could it get worse from here?
