11421122112112.content:
A couple of minutes had passed, as you were still wondering what you had gotten yourself into. The day started on such a high, humiliating both your arch nemesis and her closest friend, the cherry on top was that you even nailed the meeting with Stephanie Beachwood.

However, that cute little intern Michelle had domesticated you in a days matter. That by itself pissed you to the core, as you had worked hard, your entire life and for what? An intern that had beautiful size 5 feet, which were perfectly pedicured and... "Silly James" - You thought to yourself as you put another Treasurer cigar in your mouth. It was true, she knew your weakness and she knew how to use it, something in you even found it interesting. How did she find it so easily, while the other colleagues, mainly the devil herself, Denise, did not?

Maybe it was you being that good in covering it? "No, it wasn't that." You continued thinking, as small pieces of ash fell down from your cigar. She was definitely cunning and knew where to find people's weak spot. That by itself had probably come from her father's people skills. What if you...

Your thought process was interrupted as you heard Jacinta's voice calling you on your station. "M-mister James, Candice wants to see you, should I let her in?" Jacinta's voice was one of worry as she knew what had happened earlier with the spilt coffee and was almost sure what Candice wanted to talk about.

"Tell her to come on in, as a matter of fact, I told her to come and pay me a visit." What you said, by itself, was a lie. However, you did expect that she would be paying you a visit, especially after you forced her best friend to go through a rooftop of errands.

"James. I will have you know that ruining my new dress is unacceptable and I will not tolerate you, no matter what you are Junior..." Candice's attempt to get one on you was immediately stopped.

"Candice, I am aware that what I did, when I did it was wrong. As such I have a little surprise for you." With that, you pulled a coupon, which would cover up to four pieces of dress from Oscar De La Renta and got it in front of Candice.

"J-J-James... y-you... son of a..." Candice was in awe, losing complete composure, which was visible by her stuttering.

"Of course, such a coupon does not come for free." You looked at her with a smug face, slowly guiding her to sit on the chair, as she could only follow your movements. With that you sat opposing to her, crossing your legs to a 4 figure sitting position.

"What do you want, James?" Candice regained her composure as she realized she was still talking to the guy that spilt coffee on her and the one she hated the most since she came to work to this place.

"Quite simple actually. I know that Kim asks you for any meetings she has, as well as the numbers of the agents of her clients. By tomorrow, I want you to provide me with all of her meetings for the next 6 weeks." You commanded as you were looking into her eyes, with an icy cold gaze that could freeze anybody's core.

"Are you insane? How do you know that your friend Jenny doesn't have that information and just doesn't want to give it to you? And even if it was in me, why would I give it up so easily" Candice exclaimed as she knew that by doing so, it would be breaching company policies. Even more so, those were the managers' meetings, she could lose her job off of that.

"The information is in you and I know it is." You said as you drew attention to your hands, folding them and leaving no trace of doubt in your actions. "Kim is not stupid, she knows that I and Jenny are friends so it would be risky for her, considering I am second in command. Secondly, I know that Oscar De La Renta is your favourite clothing after all the clothes you wore earlier were imitations of it." With that, you stood up, opening another window and lighting up yet another cigar.

"How did y-you... Why do you think I would betray Kim, you are aware that if she catches is, both of us are going to be fired, regardless of your standing as a Junior Manager." - Candice was both surprised and shocked at how well you knew her, which made her even more pissed she didn't know you better."

"Because, when I replace her, you will be my personal secretary, instead of Jacinta or Jenny." You turned around facing her, while still smoking your cigar. That by itself shocked Candice, she couldn't believe what she was hearing.

"You want me as your personal secretary? Is that so?" Candice wondered, was working for the person she hated the most if she were to get double her current salary worth it? Yes, yes it was because then she would definitely be able to find his weakness and humiliate him, the way he did in the long run.

"Alright James, I accept your deal. " Candice smirked, as she crossed and uncrossed her legs, which my itself made you take quick glimpses at them. Her high heels definitely complimented her beautiful... "Not again James, you already have a Mistress." You thought to yourself, as you went back to your desk and pulled out a contract, which you had previously prepared for this very moment.

"I, James Harris, pledge to have Candice be the Manager's personal secretary, upon the change of the current representative and to have the salary doubled without any further review if the discussed below criteria are met by the agreeing party. If by any chance, the following is not kept, it will be considered a breach of contract and the one that has written it, will have to pay one-year reparations for the difference in salary."

It felt too good, Candice was unsure of why James would write a contract like that, however, it did not hurt her in any way. Even if they were both to be fired, upon Kim's inevitable change, he would have to pay her 45000$ of salary, which she would love. Even if she did get the spot, she would be able to find his weakness and get a salary double. What a delight! With that, she signed the contract, smiling as she handed it to him, as she told him, she would have the files by tomorrow.

"Well well, guess Michelle blackmailing me definitely gave me something to think about." You thought as you slowly put off the rest of your cigar and threw it in the bin.

The contract was indeed beneficial for her, however, you had never mentioned you would be the one sitting in the new managers' seat. After all, your mistress wanted to climb the ladder and you promised her you would help her to. However, you knew that you could also take up the opportunity and use Michelle's position as Mister B's daughter and rise up in ranking, either here, or in that firm. You would also be able to have that cute little brunette's toes on your face for when you wanted to, two birds with one stone.

So what will it be from here? Will you inform Michelle of your plan as she wanted you to, or would you surprise her and go something else right now, to further increase your chances in your plan succeeding?
11421122112112.title: Candice barges into your office, still pissed

choices: Skip to tonight with Jacinta
Denise comes in, still pissed about what happened to Candice
Michelle enters your office
114211221122.content:
"Thank you for gathering all this for me Jacinta." You say with a softening tone. "This couldn't have been easy to find in such a short amount of time. I think you deserve a reward for all your hard work."

Jacinta began to blush at your compliments. "Oh no sir. It's no trouble, really. It's all part of being your secretary. I live to serve." She rambles with a bow.

"Jacinta, you're accepting this reward and liking it." You order, silencing her. "First, I... apologize for my outburst towards you earlier today. That was out of line."

Jacinta put a hand to her mouth in shock. "N-no no, it's fine. I was out of line asking my new boss to go out for drinks with me. I understand." God did she actually look kind of cute when she was embarrassed.

"The second part of your reward. A pay raise, as well as a nicer desk for you. I'll even let you put it within eyesight of me." You could see tears of joy forming in her eyes at your kindness. Ever since your promotion, you've been kind of a dick to everyone, her included. So seeing you be so nice to her was a breath of fresh air.

Before she could try to decline your offer, you speak again. "Lastly, I'm thinking I will take you up on that offer of drinks tonight. My place, after work." That did it, the waterworks had started as Jacinta's crying was making her makeup start to run.

"Really?! That's wonderful! Thank you sir. I'll be there as soon as I can when I get off work. Is there anything else you require of me, sir?" She asks, trying not to sniffle.

"That'll be all for now Jacinta. You can return to work now." As she closes the door to get back to her desk, you are left with a strange feeling. It felt... nice. Is this what kindness felt like? You take a seat at your desk as you look over the info Jacinta brought you.

What happens next?
114211221122.title: Jacinta deserved some praise, take her out on a...

choices: You apologised to Michelle - far too risky not to!
To hell with her! She may have been bullshitting anyway!
1142112212.content:
Perhaps it was the ego boost after the successful meeting with Stephanie that made you feel compelled to confront the bratty little intern. Maybe it was simply the fact that she had bested you verbally before; either way, you found yourself sauntering over to her, a grin plastered all over your face.

"Well, if isn't the new intern! Doing really important jobs I'm sure like...fetching coffees? Shredding paper? Or has one of these losers that I don't even need to acknowledge anymore not entrusted you with that much responsibility?" You sniggered, maintaining eye contact with the brunette, not daring to allow your eyes to wander downward like last time.

Michelle stared at you, a playful smile forming on her lips. Folding her arms, she raised an eyebrow. "Well, that's not very nice is it."

"What's not nice, intern? Reminding you of the fact that you're nothing here - just a little bug to people like me. A bug that will be squashed in no time, don't you worry?" You flashed her your pearly whites, feeling much more self-assured than you did before. Yet, this early twenty-something did not seem in the slightest bit concerned or cowed. In fact, she seemed rather amused! This bugged you...

"What...nothing to say?" You continued to grin at her, shrugging your shoulders. "Wow, to think that you actually managed to go back and forth with me earlier this morning. We'll put that down to beginner's luck shall we? Anyway, intern loser - go and fetch me a coffee. There's a good girl..." For a moment you thought about patting her patronisingly on the head.

No, that would be too far...you haven't dominated her enough yet. That can come in time!

Still staring at you, the same damnable smirk on her face, Michelle didn't budge an inch.

"Helloooo? What's wrong - you not able to hear me...are your little intern brains at maximum capacity at something?" You sniggered again but your snorts dissipated quickly away, almost engulfed by the silence that shrouded your foe.

Finally, she decided to speak. "No," is all the gorgeous brunette simply, a look on her face very much like a lioness would have before tearing apart a gazelle. In your peripheral vision, you noticed her left leg crossing over the other, the toes of her foot pushing slightly against the floor so her sole raised a little.

"I don't think you understand," you retorted, softly and menacingly, your smile now totally vanished as you tempted to out-psych this newbie. "Go. And. Get. Me. A. Coffee."

Leaning forward so that she literally a few centimetres from you, Michelle whispered close to your ear. "Kiss my ass, John."

Stepping backwards, she stood right in front of you, her arms still folded and a sneer on her face. Your mouth suddenly dry and once again words failing to form as coherently as before, you tried and failed to stop your eyes from shifting downwards at her pretty toes, adorned with red nail varnish.

"It's...it's James, you...not John," you spluttered. "Now, you listen..."

Your words trailed off completely as she suddenly put one small finger directly over your lips, catching you totally by surprise. "Do you know who I am, John?"

Completely failing to find any words at all now, you simply shake your head, still in shock that this brat would have the temerity to silence you like this!

"I'm the daughter of Mr B - you know - the company's, like, main partner. I'm here to get a bit of experience as an intern." She shrugged her shoulders suddenly. "I don't give a shit about this place, or you. Not you, not anyone can tell me what to do. If may Daddy saw you talking crap to me, he would totally get you fired. Like that." She pulled her finger from your lips and clicked it for emphasis.

Shit. Shit, shit, shit!

Mr B was indeed a major partner to the organisation. He was long-term affiliate who was known to be jovial most of the time but possessed a foul temper if things did not go his way...

"So Daddy - he told me I had to, like, work without pay first." She rolled her hazel eyes, talking as though you were barely even there. "Not that I need the money of course." She fixed with you with a smug, content look. One that has probably gotten this bratty princess anything she's ever wanted, you couldn't help but think.

Finally, some words managed to form as you adopted a friendly smile. "Now, Michelle, there's no need for you to worry about anything." You suddenly laughed, which made her frown a little. "I mean, just a bit of office banter, you know."

"Office banter? You just called me a bug that needed to be squashed...you demanded that I get you a coffee...that doesn't sound like banter to me, Jeff," Michelle replied, a smile on her lips but her eyes as hard and cold as stone.

Ignoring the deliberate attempt to antagonise you with another erroneous name, you merely continued to smile. "Oh, no...no I didn't mean that. No, no...I wouldn't actually expect you to take that seriously!"

"So you think I'm stupid? You think I'm, like, this total idiot who can't understand banter?" She gave you another smug look, clearly enjoying seeing you squirm.

This was not going well at all! Your attempts to dominate this intern had backfired spectacularly. Had you known who she was, you would have never, NEVER attempted to get one over on her like this! Dammit, you really should have waited for Jacinta to dig some dirt on her before confronting her again! Realising that your options were limited at this point, you knew that it would be better to make peace and swallow your pride, you quickly decided what to do...
1142112212.title: Second Confrontation with Michelle!

choices: Michelle wanted you to get on your knees and apologise again!
Michelle told you to put in a good word for her with Kim!
Something else...
11421122121.content:
She had you...this little intern with the damn sexy bare feet had you! Still staring at you, a confident smirk plastered all over her gorgeous face, she looked positively thrilled when you began to apologise to her.

"Michelle, I'm...sorry..." You stated through clenched teeth.

"What? What was that, John?" She said, a teasing look about her as she taunted you. "I don't think EVERYONE around here heard you properly..."

Several coworkers seemed to be fixing their gazes over at the pair of you. Wishing that the brat would just accept your apology and let you move on, you adopted the most sincere and humble expression possible. Having charmed enough clients over the past few years, this was something that you were good at - manipulating and controlling people!

"I said..." You paused, trying best to ignore the stares of the onlookers around you. "I said, Michelle, that I am sorry. I am sorry for speaking to you like that and for...for...not respecting you sufficiently." You finished, forcing an affable smile on your face. Michelle seemed to be having none of it though...

"I don't believe you," she replied cooly, shaking her head in a disappointed fashion. "You called me a 'bug', that I needed to 'fetch me a coffee', that I was a 'good girl'..." She emphasised these last words in a sardonic fashion. "It's gonna take more than a bullshit apology for me to be convinced."

Feeling your cheeks start to redden, both from embarrassment and for a rising anger swirling around you, you took a breath and nodded politely. "Of course - all of those things I said were just part of office banter, you know...." You looked around for support but were met with frosty, unimpressed expressions of people you had either trampled on professionally before, or had barely given a second glance in your rise to power.

"It wasn't banter, John...Jeff...what is your name anyway?" Before you could answer she held a hand out in front of your face. "Ya, ya...whatever. Anyway, prove you're useful to me - go and fetch me a coffee..."

Rooted to the spot, you tried to ignore the snorts and giggles of those surrounding you - now a fairly decently-sized crowd. It took a certain degree of self-control not to tell this stupid little brat to go fuck herself! Instead, you shifted your gaze down to the ground, which of course was a mistake.

"Uh, coffee boy, quit staring at my feet like a weirdo...go fetch my coffee already!!" Michelle said with disdain. A few people actually cheered a little, high-fiving one another as you found yourself turning around and, in a trance-like state, heading towards the coffee machine.

"Cappuccino...extra foam!" The intern called out cheerily to you, her words only just registering. You had been humbled, owned, destroyed by this petite brunette. The fact that she was Mr B's daughter - it was just too risky to do anything than obey her. Imagine if she told her Daddy how rude you had been, how you had tried ordering her around...realising that the best thing you could possibly do right now was get her coffee and hope that the crowd dispersed, you quickened your movements and tapped the necessary buttons on the machine.

"Good boy," Michelle said, causing more derision from the coworkers around you once you returned, cappuccino in hand. "So there is something useful you can do, after all!"

"Sure..." you muttered, wishing that this ordeal would just be over with now. Realising that people were now openly laughing at you, you attempted to regain some sort of control on the situation. "You're welcome, Michelle. Glad to help the intern on her first day. Anyway - I've gotta get back to some important work. Being Junior Manager means there's always plenty of money to make for the company after all... OK, see ya!" You told her brightly, staring daggers at anyone who continued to smirk at you, their eyes averting from you.

Trying your best to keep the confident grin on your face, you turned nodding curtly at Michelle before strolling away, wishing to get as much distance between the gorgeous brunette and you as possible.

"Hey, there's one more thing!" She suddenly called out, making you stop dead in your tracks...what did she want now?!
11421122121.title: Apology to Michelle!

choices: Kim! Perfect timing to put in your good word about Michelle to her!
Denise! What did she want?
Someone else...!
114211221212.content:
Turning around, a look of discomfort etched on your face, you tried your best to give Michelle a friendly smile. "Sure..." you spoke through gritted teeth. "What is it now?"

A look of smugness plastered all over her attractive face, Michelle beckoned you back over to where she stood, shooing away the damnable crowd who reluctantly - and thankfully - began dispersing. When the last onlookers finally were out of earshot, Michelle lent forward, a soft giggle escaping her lips.

"I want you...." she said slowly and deliberately. Despite yourself, you felt a little aroused by how seductively and closely she was talking to you. "I want you to...put in a good word with the boss for me."

You blinked and stepped back a little. "A good word? What...what do you want me to say exactly?"

"Use your common sense...what are you, like, simple?" Giving you a dismissive wave of her hand and studying her carefully manicured nails, the brat continued as though you were barely even there. "You'll think of something, John. You'll make it clear that I'm awesome, that's the important thing."

"It's James," you practically growled, still finding it taking a great effort to remain calm. "J-A-M-E-S!"

"What?" She replied, her face frowning for a moment. "I don't give a shit about the details. Just make me seem awesome. Got it?" Giving you a challenging look, hands on her hips, you couldn't notice one foot resting a little on the other. Her gorgeous toes spreading a little...

"Earth to John....!"

"I, er, yeah...I'll tell the boss something...." You forced yourself to refocus, accepting the fact that this beautiful brunette was now firmly in charge of the situation. If you refused her, the intern would surely tell her father, implicating you and potentially destroying your career. Ruefully wishing that you had simply waited for the information from Michelle, you merely nodded while she gave you a patronising pat on the head.

"Good boy," she snickered. "Do what I tell you, like my good little pet, and you've got nothing to worry about..." With another giggle, she happily turned on her heel and strolled away, leaving you standing like a fool. Finding yourself staring after her, you caught a glimpse of one bare sole lifting a little off the ground.

A perfect, silky smooth bare sole. One that you would desperately love to kiss and lick, caressing your tongue all over it...

"NO!" You didn't realise that you had actually shouted out loud. A few puzzled stares came your way, along with several smirks - from the same who witnessed Michelle's total verbal dominance over you before. Resuming your karate breathing technique, you headed straight to your office, realising that you needed a few minutes in peace.

"Mister James! I...I found some information...about the...intern..." Jacinta's voice trailed off as she stood awkwardly, watching you storm into your office, walking straight past her.

"What?" You snarled. "What is it now?"

"Erm, about Michelle. I...found out that she's the daughter-"

"Yes, yes, yes! I got that already. Thanks." Giving her a foul look, she practically cowered, stepping backwards and fixing her gaze on the ground.

"Sorry, Mister...James...I'll just..."

"Get the hell out of here. I need some time alone," you told her curtly, your heart still racing as you thought about how much that damned intern had humbled you in front of other people. Scurrying away without another word, Jacinta closed the door behind you, leaving you at last alone and with your thoughts.

There must be a way out of this, surely! Yes Michelle is the daughter of Mr B...and is admittedly very attractive...and seems to be very comfortable barefoot...which by the way are incredibly delectable...

Forcing your mind to stop and practising your breathing techniques, you knew that this was a very dangerous train of thought! It was an impossible situation; if you didn't say anything to Kim with the intention of praising Michelle, then the brat would know, surely. So, something had to be said - that was a fact. What you said though...what could you say about her that would be logical and fair. One thought hit you - Michelle was certainly confident, very self-assured, despite her immaturity. Yes, yes you could easily tell Kim how you noticed that the new intern was confident and comfortable around people - so comfortable in fact that she was walking around barefoot...

Could you mention that to Kim too, or would that possibly be a risk, depending on how Kim took that? Either way, you knew that you had to act quickly so you could refocus on your work and try your very best to forget about Michelle and forget about her, no matter how sexy she and her feet were!

Suddenly a knock on the door interrupted your thoughts. Who was it?
114211221212.title: A Good Word for Michelle?

choices: You told Kim about Michelle being barefoot - and how inappropriate that was!
You decided to confide in Kim and ask for her help with Michelle!
Change of heart - you told Kim it was nothing!
1142112212121.content:
"So how is the new Junior Manager getting on so far today?" The appearance of your boss Kim, snapped you to attention. Hastily getting standing to your feet to greet her, a hopefully charming smile on your face, you walked towards her to shake her hand.

"Kim! It's...all good!" You told her, trying to fix your mind away from Michelle and the whole situation. "Today's been great, so far actually."

"Oh, that I'm sure of," she chuckled, sitting on one of the leather chairs around the meeting area of your office. Quickly taking a seat next to her, you felt your chest practically puff out with pride as she began relaying back to you how impressed Stephanie Beachwood was, how the company are fully vindicated in your promotion.

Adopting a modest but still confident tone, you continued to smile and soak up the praise. "Well, you know, hard work does pay off."

"It certainly does," she stated, smiling warmly. "So, anything else we need to catch up on before I leave you to it?" The redhead started smoothing out her business suit, preparing to rise to her feet. She was attractive, there was no doubt about that. Even though she was a good ten or so years older than you, she'd probably be dynamite in the bedroom...

Snapping quickly away from that train of thought, you knew far better than to mix business with pleasure. "No there's..."

Kim raised an eyebrow. "Yes, James? What is it?" She tapped her foot a little impatiently on the floor - freshly cleaned by Jacinta earlier and still practically sparkling.

The thought of Michelle's smug face was dominating your thoughts. You had to tell Kim - you had to do what the brat told you. It would be career suicide to risk the intern's wrath; with her powerful father, a hugely influential man on the entire organisation, one bad word could cause irreparable damage to you!

Clearing your throat, you tried to ignore the now slightly irritated look on your boss's face. "Er, the new intern...I don't know her name..."

"Yes, Michelle," Kim said curtly, her eyes widening very briefly.

"She's very...impressive. I mean, I haven't seen her work on a professional capacity much so far but...but she's smart. I mean, seriously smart. She completely owned Bob from Human Resources. She was so confident, impressive...she's...she's one to watch. That was all - I just wanted to pass that on to you."

Kim stared at you, her expression unreadable until mercifully she broke out into a smile. "Well, that's great to hear James! Yes, I had scoured her file earlier and was blown away by her SAT scores and GPAs. And yes - in person she is certainly smart, confident...I know she's just an intern..." Kim coughed slightly, as though there was more to the story that she could not inform you about... "Anyway, interns need to make a good impression. They need to grab those proverbial brass rings - they need to get noticed and make their way up the ladder."

Picturing Michelle's dainty, gorgeous feet stepping up a ladder, you had to visibly shake the thought away, which made Kim frown a little.

"You OK, James? Anyway...if there's anything else?" Kim stood up, clearly now wanting to get on with her day.

A thought crossed your mind. This would not be the end of it, surely. Yes, you did Michelle a favour; the brat had got what she wanted - a good word to the boss. Yet, being around her, you didn't stand the chance - not when she was barefoot, at least.

"Er, Kim, there is one more thing actually...."

What did you tell Kim?
1142112212121.title: Meeting with Kim

choices: You told Jacinta to put her shoes back on!
You left the office - back over to reception to see your friend, Jenny!
You tried your best to be assertive even though Jacinta was barefoot!
11421122121211.content:
"James..." Kim's sharp tone made you actually jump up to your feet. "I haven't got all day...!" Your boss was now checking her watching and tapping her foot against the ground more impatiently than before.

"The thing is. Er, it's...it's not such a big deal. But Michelle she...she seems to like being barefoot a lot..." You gulped, hoping that did not come out anywhere as near as it sounded.

Kim surpassed a laugh. "That was it? That the intern doesn't wear shoes? OK then James..." She gave you a sardonic grin, her eyes rolling, which made you feel even more of a fool. "I'll log that somewhere carefully away. Hey, maybe I shouldn't wear my shoes either..."

The redhead suddenly slipped out of her shoes, causing her to shrink several inches in height. Figuratively-wise, your boss seemed to appear a few feet higher! Having her barefoot made you instinctively shift your gaze to the ground, your eyes caught like a fly in a spider's web at her pretty toes, each one adorned in red nail varnish...

"No wonder that bothers you," Kim said softly, her voice snapping you out of your trance. "What is it, you think my feet are gross, or they stink?"

"N-no...n-not at all! They're...your feet...they're...th-they're nice!" You babbled at her, feeling your cheeks go red with embarrassment. Why the hell had you mentioned Michelle being barefoot?! Of course - Kim would be well aware that Michelle was the daughter of Mr B; the fact that the bratty intern enjoyed being barefoot was no concern to Kim whatsoever!

Staring at you curiously, Kim's corners of her mouth twitched. "Wow, you are really easy to mess with! James, don't fret it. I know that being Junior Manager is a big deal for you - for anyone, for that matter," she clarified carefully. "So, I know you take your job even more seriously. But I don't need foot reports on an intern or anyone else for that matter. If you wanna kick off your shoes and feel more comfortable, be my guest!"

Relieved that she did not think your awkwardness was anything to do with actually liking feet, you tried your best to adopt a casual grin, giving her a cheery wave goodbye as she picked up her heels and strolled out of your office.

Closing the door behind her, you felt a little giddy and out of breath. Massaging your temples and resuming your karate breathing techniques from before, you had to tell yourself something reassuring, something empowering...

You were the king. These people were mere peasants to you! Even Kim - one day you'll be HER boss!

As you took in one more deep breath, walking over to your desk, the door reopened with Jacinta standing there. Her shy smile and non-confrontational personality was a welcome sigh of relief. Not so welcome was what she was holding in her hands...

"Your shoes," you stated thickly. "Why are you...why are you holding your...shoes?"

Jacinta let out a nervous giggle. "Oh, Mister James...it was Kim - the boss. I saw her right now...she told me...."

Her words were swept away by an unpleasant, sinking feeling that spread around every fibre of your being. You didn't need Jacinta - of all people - to spell it out for you! Who else would Kim tell that it was OK to be barefoot at the office?! It would begin with your doting secretary, then other co-workers, clients even...Denise...! That last thought made you turn a little pale - both out of fear and admitted curiosity of your ultimate nemesis's bare feet...

"Mister James? Mister James...I'm just going to put these here...." Your secretary moved nervously over to her desk, carefully placing her open-toed black heels under it. Again, on autopilot, you felt your eyes darting over to her peds. Jacinta was wearing nylons - not that dissimilar in colour to actual skin tone, which was relatively pale.

A strand of white-blonde hair falling over her sweating forehead, Jacinta continued to stare at you. "Mister James...are you OK? W-was it what I said about that intern?"

"No...no," you said, in a slightly croaky voice as you wrenched your head upwards to meet her eye contact. "That's all...that's all fine..."

"So there's nothing else you want to know about her?" Jacinta continued, a slight look of irritation on her face as her cheeks reddened a little.

"No...no...it's...fine..." you replied absently, barely registering the fact that your secretary spoke to you rather bluntly, for her at least.

The blonde smiled blandly at you, a slightly odd look on her face as she sat at her desk, her feet in fall view of you - not the soles but the tops of them, including her long, slender toes, which had white nail paint on each of them.

"I said...what do you want me to do next?" Jacinta called across at you, an expectant look on her face.

This was your nightmare! With her being barefoot in the room around you, you could not be your usual, dominant self! Trying to focus and ignore the fact that she was barefoot was proving harder, much harder than you ever could have anticipated! For a person who actually prided himself on being dismissive, abrupt - rude, even, it was as if you had been weakened!

Clearing your throat, you knew that things could not continue like this. This was the first day as Junior Manager - you had to assert your authority and take back control of the situation, every situation! You had to either force yourself to be an asshole to Jacinta and keep her in her damned place, or find something else to do in the office....
11421122121211.title: Mentioning Michelle Barefoot to Kim

choices: You went to find Helena - time to put the janitor in her place!
You decided to stay put and wait for your next client
114211221212111.content:
"Mister James?" Jacinta was now looking at you with clear annoyance on her face, her eyes narrowing at you as she awaited your answer.

"Put your shoes back on," you told her, as firmly as you could.

Her mouth opening to form an 'O' of surprise, Jacinta stared at you incredulously. "What? Put my shoes...on?"

"You heard me, or do you need your ears tested?" You said sardonically, buoyed by the fact that your swagger was returning. "I don't need this office smelling like a mouldy cheese factory, and neither does my client this afternoon who's coming in an hour!"

"I...but...Mrs Kim....she told me..."

"I know what she told you!" You snapped at her, now standing up and pointing at the shoes under her desk. "Put. Them. ON!"

Jacinta gulped, a sense of panic about her as she bent down, fumbling around with her shoes. "I'm...Mister James...I didn't..."

"Hurry up," you growled. "Every second with your disgusting feet out stinks out this place even more! OK, here's what you're going to do when you've FINALLY managed to figure out the mechanism that attaches your shoes back to your stinking feet! I want you to get some air freshener in here - get rid of that funky foot smell you've caused. THEN, I want alphabetised files for each of the clients that I have scheduled for the rest of the week, including prospective ones. After that...."

Feeling adrenaline pump through your veins, it felt a relief...no, a necessity to resume your abrasive ways with Jacinta. She was a mere secretary - nothing to you. So far beneath her that she deserved...needed to be spoken to like this. Just like all of the other people below you. People who never thought you would have gotten this far. People who didn't need to be barefoot around you like Michelle, Kim and Jacinta just now...

Jacinta scurried out of the office, returning with air freshener, including a release pod, which let out a fragrant vanilla scent every half hour or so - that's what she claimed at least. The blonde secretary could barely make eye contact with you since you put her firmly in her place. While she busied herself with the organising and filing tasks that you set her, your mind wandered over to the previous events of the day....

It all started on such a high, embarrassing Candice, then that stupid cleaner Helena. Spilling your scalding coffee on Candice was a necessity; had you not, that vindictive bitch would've held the upper hand on you, without a doubt. The meeting with Stephanie was beyond successful...it could not have gone better! Humbling Jacinta and making it clear to her that she will NOT be barefoot around you was the latest minor victory, especially after seeing how she changed with you being less forceful around her.

Yet, there were niggling worries. Most of them were due to Michelle - that little intern (with the damned sexy feet) was going to prove troublesome, to say the least. Still, you had done as bidden and put in a good word for her with Kim. Helena, the janitor, was another one who had got one over you today, refusing to clean your office. A thought crossed your mind...

It was unlikely you'd ever dominate Michelle - she was simply someone to avoid and hope that she would move on from the office. However, Helena - she was someone who could be cowed, be taken down a few pegs. Checking the time, you had around twenty minutes...enough time to find something to chastise and take your frustrations out on Helena with! Or was it better to avoid seeking any trouble and wait patiently for your next client?
114211221212111.title: Jacinta's Shoes Back On!

choices: Michelle - uh oh!
Jenny...phew!
Someone else...
1142112212121111.content:
"Right - I'm off on a couple of...errands..." You chose your words carefully. "Give this place another spruce up, will you? At least it doesn't have the cheesy feet smell here anymore!"

"Yes, Mister James," Jacinta nodded rapidly, blushing again and clearly regretting the fact that she ever took her shoes off in the first place.

Good. That's how it should be!

Strolling out of your new office, you knew that the Hispanic Janitor would not be far away. Sure enough, she carrying a mop and bucket with her on the way back from cleaning the bathrooms.

"Ooh, here she is! The world's least effective cleaning lady," you announced loudly. Giving Helena your best smirk, you stared daggers at her. "Oh a mop won't do in my office, honey. You're gonna need polish, clothes...that's where you're heading next, right?"

Helena glared at you, her eyes full of anger and loathing. "You always talk so much crap to me. Screw you." She attempted to to brush past you but you held up your hands as if taming a wild bull that was about to charge through.

"Whoah, whoah steady there!" Closer up, you had to admit that Helena was attractive. Very attractive, to be fair in terms f her face. And her body - it was a curvy, hourglass figure that you could just about make out under her work attire. Despite her hard features, she had sparkling hazel eyes, a cute nose very symmetrical features. Her long brown hair tied into a bun did not help her look anywhere near as glamorous as she could, nor did her pink, cleaning skivvies of course!

"What is it? What?" She practically spat at you, dropping the mop and bucket to the ground. "You mad at me for not bowing and scraping to you, is that it, white boy? Oh, look at the king...look at him walk around like he's the fucking ruler of the world!"

Pleased to be getting this reaction, you tutted disapprovingly. "Dear oh dear, Helena. Cursing and using a racial slur. Oh the bosses won't like that at all."

"You say what the hell you want!" The Mexican woman seethed, narrowing her eyes and screwing up her face to show you how much she detested you. "You wanna take me on - you got nothing on me!"

"Well, technically that's not true, is it? You refused to clean my office after the accident with Candice Watson earlier. You've used racial remarks and swear words against me - both of which are breaking company protocol and policy," you stated calmly. "I could go on...should I?"

"I have had it with you!" The janitor snarled and lunged forward with her mop, aiming it at your face. Expertly ducking, then sidestepping neatly - thanks to your karate training, you felt tempted to return a blow of your own, stopping yourself just in time.

"Helena, really!" You smirked, your eyes blazing victoriously at the fact that she had finally lost her temper with you and was made to look like a fool. "That's just another incident that I may have to...report..."

Your voice trailed off and looked down at your khaki pants...why were they dripping and covered in soap suds...?! Taking a breath, you look further down to see the bucket knocked over where you had sidestepped rapidly, the water all over the floor and - apparently - all over your pants!

Looking up furiously at Helena, you recoiled a little at the look of pure triumph on her face. "Report what? Report that you just kicked a bucket of water and suds on you? Ha! What a loser!" She chuckled in disdain at you, eyes glinting malevolently at wear the water was dripping, from at least halfway up your pants down to your shoes.

Tossing the mop to you, she continued to chuckle. "I didn't make the mess. He did, right?" The mid-30s janitor looked around for support.

"Oh, sure I saw what happened..."

Who was it who witnessed the altercation between you and the Mexican cleaner?
1142112212121111.title: Confrontation with Helena!

choices: Sucking it up, you did as instructed by Michelle!
You simply couldn't! You stormed away!
11421122121211111.content:
The petite, dainty form of Michelle appeared in front of both you and the Hispanic janitor. A malevolent smile on her gorgeous face, the brunette looked between the two of you.

"You saw?" You stared at her hopefully, though you could feel your heart racing already. Not Michelle - of all people! Then again, perhaps she had encountered Kim; your redhead boss could have mentioned your glowing report of her. Not the foolish mention of her being barefoot though... Your eyes flickered downwards at that thought. Yep, Michelle was of course barefoot once more!

"Uh, yeah John. I saw everything," the intern said softly, her voice with a mocking tone to it. "Speak to the boss yet?"

You had mixed feelings about that! At least Kim wouldn't have mentioned your slip about Michelle being barefoot - assuming of course that Michelle was not messing with you.

Before you could answer, Helena cleared her throat, causing both you and Michelle to turn to her. "Excuse me, Miss. You seem nice, fair. This arrogant...jerk...he caused the mess, you saw, right?"

Stifling a giggle, Michelle bit her lip. "Arrogant jerk, really?"

"Yeah! He try to boss me around all the time. He so rude to me! He tried to make me grovel and bow down to him, si!" The Mexican woman gave you a look of pure loathing before turning back to Michelle. "Please, you on my side with this?"

Michelle frowned, looking between the two of you as though she were the judge, jury and executioner. Dammit...this newbie did hold the power! Being the daughter of an extremely, wealthy partner to the firm meant that you were truly at her mercy! Yet you could not help but speak up...

"Michelle, please. This woman is lazy, incompetent and has been undermining me the moment I started working here. She's had it in for me for years! Since I've become Junior Manager..." You puffed up your chest a little while Michelle yawned disinterestedly. "Helena...she's used racial slurs, refused to do her job...and look at what she's done - she attacked me with a mop!"

Rolling her eyes, the petite brunette looked distinctly unimpressed with you. "Jim, this woman....Helena, right? Helena, has every right to totally complain about you. It's, like, racial discrimination! You really wanna see whose side the boss's take? A beautiful, hardworking woman from....Mexico?" She smiled at the janitor after she nodded in affirmation. "Of you, a privileged white boy?"

Your mouth hung open. Man, Michelle had turned this on you so quickly. Helena had a smug, satisfied smirk plastered all over her face as she sidled up next to the intern, her arms folded to mimic your tormentor's body posture. "She right - the bosses they won't believe you." Turning to Michelle, the janitor smiled warmly. "Thank you, thank you so much miss for seeing the truth and not listening to this arrogant monstruo."

"Now hang on a moment...!" You spluttered out, knowing that speaking up against Michelle was potentially foolish, yet you could not let Helena win like this! "Michelle, seriously, I've done nothing wrong! She's got it in for me...please!" You felt yourself become increasingly desperate, your voice turning high-pitched and pleading.

Her eyebrows raised and an amused look about her, Michelle shook her head. "I believe Helena. Now, rather than her and I going to the boss right now, if I were you, I'd do exactly what I tell you, John..."

The fact that she remembered Helena's name after one mention and still could not get you stung, though not as much as what she next said. "You are gonna to Helena here, then you'll clean up the rest of this floor space - until she's happy with it."

What the...!

Exasperated yet well-aware of who Michelle was the daughter of, you gave yourself a few moments before responding. Helena looked so smug, so triumphant...could you actually apologise to the janitor, then clean the floor space...?!
11421122121211111.title: Michelle - uh oh!

choices: All completed with no-one seeing you. Phew!
Someone saw you! But who...?
114211221212111111.content:
Put in an impossible position, you felt trapped and defeated. Your mouth coarse and dry, you let out a small, "Sorry, Helena."

"Oh, nooo, no, no nooo!" Michelle giggled as she shook her head from side to side. "That was bullcrap! Apologise like you mean it!"

Clearing your throat, you tried again. "Sorry, Helena. Sorry for...making this mess."

Helena continued to smirk at you, her hands on her hips. For years and years she had waited for this moment to humble you, to put you in your place. Yet, she shook her head as she made a tutting noise.

"I agree, Helena," Michelle chuckled. "Again, John. Apologise like you mean it!"

"I...I'm really sorry," you said through clenched teeth. "For making a mess, for being rude to you..."

Still the women were not satisfied. Biting her lip and playing with her hair seductively, Michelle had another idea. "On your knees, John. Then we'll know you're truly sorry!"

Your knees shaking, you knew that the only way out of this was to play along and suck it up. With Michelle around, you were totally at her mercy and if that meant humiliating yourself in front of the janitor, of all people, then so be it!

Dropping to your knees, both women looked satisfied. "Please, Helena, I am so sorry for causing such a mess. I...I know I've been a jerk to you...I'm really sorry for my behaviour. I...I promise I will be nicer to you. Please, please can you forgive me!"

Helena practically shivered with pleasure as she stared down at you, a victorious air about her as she finally nodded with satisfaction. "Si. Now you can go clean, John."

So she was going to call you the wrong name too now...of course she was!

"John, fetch us both a coffee - we're gonna put our feet up and have a little break while you go do a bit of cleaning. Got that?" Michelle grinned at you, patting your head patronisingly like earlier. Only this time she was actually taller than you, as you were still on your knees.

"Sure..." You muttered awkwardly, before hurriedly getting to your feet and heading towards the machine. The sound of the brunette clearing her throat forced you to turn round. "Er, yeah. I mean, what is it...what can I...?"

Sighing at your apparent uselessness, Michelle gestured dramatically to her Mexican companion. "Aren't you gonna ask what Helena wants, Jeff?"

Closing your eyes for a moment, you forced yourself to pretend that this nightmare would be over soon and that you could get back to your safe, Helena-free office. "Sure, yep. Er, Helena, what would you...?"

"Double espresso, John," Helena told you curtly, smirking at you once more as the two women strolled off together towards two of the comfy recliners in the lobby leaving you to fetch the coffee. You knew what Michelle wanted...cappuccino, extra foam.... The second one you would be making her already today!

When you returned, minutes later, both women had their legs crossed, their bare feet dangling off the edge of their recliners, content looks about them. Gulping, you couldn't help but stare at the four soles as you approached them. Michelle's were soft, creamy, small and incredibly delicious looking. Helena's were darker, a bronze colour a little lighter than the rest of the skin. Longer than Michelle's and not quite as soft, they were very shapely and - admittedly - extremely attractive. Trying your best not to stare, you gulped as you handed over each coffee.

"Good pet," Michelle sighed, sipping her coffee and grinning at you. The nerve of this girl...yet, you were partly entranced by her and also terrified that her powerful father could end your career in a heartbeat, should you displease her. Moving her hands in a shooing movement, Helena let out a cackle of laughter, appreciating how subservient you were to the petite brunette. "That's it - go and clean now, John."

Helena gave you a cheery wave while you shuffled away, picking up the mop, moving it in awkward, circular motions around the floor. It had been a long time since you needed to pick up a mop; years and years ago, you had a brief part-time cleaning job but that seemed like a lifetime ago! In your apartment, you hired a cleaner to come by once a week for several hours. Even holding the mop in your hands was truly humbling. The fact that you could see both women drinking their coffee, their bare soles hanging off the edge of their chairs made it even more demeaning yet admittedly arousing at the same time!

For the next ten minutes, you mopped away like a madman, desperate to get the tedious task over with. Were you able to continue uninterrupted and unseen for the duration of it, or did you encounter someone while doing so?
114211221212111111.title: Apologising to Helena and mopping the floor!

choices: You chose option 1 - coffee and cleaning!
Option 2 - your new secretary!
You presented a third alternative to Michelle...
1142112212121111111.content:
Your heart beating so fast that it felt like it would break your chest, you let out a sigh of relief when you completed the mopping and carefully left the cleaning equipment back where Helena left it. Walking over to the two women, you noticed that they were in full conversation.

"So, my ex. He was...total bastard. Left me and my daughter. She eighteen now, beautiful girl," Helena said.

"Wow...so you were only seventeen?!" Michelle replied, not without a certain snootiness. "Boy, you've had it tough. Single Mom at that age, working as a cleaner here with assholes like Jeff to deal with.."

Clearing your throat, you pretended not to hear the unsubtle insult. Irritated, Michelle glowered at you while Helena narrowed her eyes menacingly.

"What?" The intern snapped. "Can't you see we're talking here?" Rolling her eyes at you, you couldn't help but flicker your eyes downward at her wiggling toes.

"I...er...I've done the cleaning," you mumbled to her. "I...I've done a good job!" You added, trying to desperately grab for some sort of prideful claim.

"Ugh... Helena - see what you think. Let me know if it's perfect!" Michelle instructed her companion. Rising to her feet, Helena stalked forward, still barefoot as she inspected your work.

"Oops..." She said, as the sound of a plastic cup hit the ground. "How clumsy!"

"You...you..." You spluttered as you felt your insides boil with rage. "I just...cleaned..."

The Hispanic janitor shrugged her shoulders and sneered at you. "Accidents happen. Guess you oughta clean it up."

"Oh, and get her another coffee too as she lost that one. I'll have the same again!" Michelle cheerily called out as you slipped your shoulders dejectedly. A taste of your own medicine...of course Helena was going to use this opportunity to embarrass you and get some revenge! Thinking back to earlier this morning when you deliberately spilt your coffee, you had no conceivable idea then that the tables would be reversed so fully!

Doing as you were bid, you hurriedly mopped over the spilt coffee, as well as Helena's footprints for good measure - just in case they tried to use that against you! Fetching two more drinks from the machine, you quickly headed back to where Helena had returned to her recliner, next to Michelle.

Nodding with approval at you while she sipped her cappuccino, Michelle sighed with satisfaction. "So, Jerry. What have you learned?"

Standing before them, trying not to steal another glance at their bare feet, you gulped. "I...I've er, learned to be nicer, er, to Helena. And I...I will be nicer to her...from now..."

Helena clicked her tongue. "That's the least, John. You've been a prick to me for so many years. Getting me some coffee and cleaning one bit of floor space is just the start."

Just the start? What did she mean?!

Michelle leaned forward eagerly as if reading your thoughts. "I've heard all about Helena and how tough things are for her. She's a single Mom. She's on minimum wage and she needs a break. You know how many times she would have cleaned that floor you reluctantly helped her with? Seriously, John, you need to get some perspective here. You're gonna help Helena here, especially now you know how hard things've been for her, and considering what a jerk you've been to her."

This did not sound good at all. "What..er...what can I do...?" You murmured weakly, knowing that Michelle was in total control of what happened here.

Michelle and the janitor looked at one another, exchanging smiles. How much had they discussed exactly while you were cleaning?

"You know what, John, I'm actually gonna give you a couple of options here," Michelle giggled as you visibly squirmed in front of her and Helena. "In both scenarios, Helena gets an improvement in her situation, that's a fact. So, here's what you now need to decide...."

God, how had you managed to let things spiral this far out of control?! If only you had left Helena alone....if only Michelle had not been there at that particular time...

"Option 1, Jeff - you grab Helena a coffee every single morning and before you go home, you will do a share of the cleaning." Michelle announced excitedly. Your heart sank; you were half-excepting this, considering what you'd been doing for the past quarter of an hour or so.

"Or..." She continued, playing with her hair, an infuriatingly cute smile on her face, "Or...Helena becomes your new secretary. You can get rid of whoever you've got working for you at the moment." Michelle stated, a dismissive wave of her hand.

Reeling in shock from the turn of events, you felt anxiety crawl inside your gut. Whatever you chose you'd be losing. The idea of getting a coffee for Helena and cleaning for her...every single day... Yet, actually having her as your secretary, forcing you to get rid of Jacinta...what was the best option?
1142112212121111111.title: All completed with no-one seeing you. Phew!

choices: Michelle has one last task before you go
Go back to your office and wait for five
Go to Kim and tell her that you'll help with the cleaning
11421122121211111111.content:
You couldn't fire Jacinta. Not only could she raise hell about losing her job on day one of being your secretary, but you weren't sure just how Helena would act as your secretary in her place. She could "accidentally" misplace important documents, scare off clients, and who knows what else in your name to make you look bad. She could get you canned within a week if you weren't careful.

Besides, you didn't climb this far up the corporate ladder without learning how to put your own spin on an incident. People have already seen you getting her coffee, so maybe you can make yourself look like the good guy by helping a hard working staff member by doing a simple thing for her. You could even spin the cleaning thing to give the appearance that "no job is beneath anyone" or whatever that chick at HR was rambling about. Who knows, maybe if you play your cards right, you can walk out of this looking like a hero, a hero that even daddy dearest Mr. B couldn't object to over something petty.

"Okay then you two, I've decided. I'll help out Helena with her cleaning and get her a coffee in the morning." The two actually looked a bit surprised. They were totally expecting you to be so disgusted by grunt work to have no issue giving her the promotion.

"Okay then, white boy, five o'clock after work I'll be in your office with a bucket so you can get started. By the way, I think that since I need every cent I can get, any overtime pay you are offered should go to me, right Michelle?" Helena asks, earning a nod from the brunette.

Well that stung a little, you were kinda hoping to get a little extra pay out of this, but you suppose it can't be helped. "Sure, after all, I'd hate to see you and your daughter thrown to the streets." You say through a twitchy smile as you extend your hand in a sign of good faith, only for her to spit in her hand before taking it. Well, you were gonna need to sanitize that later.

"Alright then whitey, I'll let you go now. Go do whatever it is you do here." She releases your hand and waves you out of the room.
11421122121211111111.title: You chose option 1 - coffee and cleaning!

choices: Denise - she was there to gloat!
Candice - she finally got back to work after the coffee incident!
Jenny - you've got some explaining to do!
114211221212111111113.content:
Always thinking of how to maximise every situation, however unfortunate it initially seemed, you decided to see Kim. Most people would avoid the boss like a plague having been put in such a humbling position. Not you though; you remembered Kim's recent drive on promoting and giving opportunities to ethnic minorities in the workplace.

"Yes, James," Kim frowned at you after letting you into her office. "Not another thing about barefoot co-workers is it?"

Ignoring the sardonic tone of her voice, you gave her a cheery smile as you sat down on a leather chair opposite her. "No, not not at all! In fact, you know that recent initiative about workers from ethnic minority origins? Well, I've just thought of a way to show how management is helping..."

At first, Kim seemed a bit taken aback by your idea - of you doing cleaning duties for an hour between 5 and 6pm, relieving the seemingly hardworking and strapped-for-cash Helena from her duties. Plus the fact that she would be getting paid the hour's overtime, even though you would be doing it!

"James...that's...wonderful!" She beamed at you. "That is exactly the kind of initiative I was hoping for! Yes, absolutely, by all means show that the management here is on the side of the little people. From what you've said, this janitor could do with some help, extra pay - she and her daughter certainly need it. Well done James!"

Feeling yourself swell with pride, you tried to ignore the fact that you would be giving up a whole hour per day - five per week - twenty per month...to help that damned Helena out, just to keep on Michelle's good side! Not to mention of course the coffee each morning, which you didn't feel necessary of informing Kim with.

Leaving the boss's office on much more positive terms than when you last saw her, you marched back to your office to check in with Jacinta. The blonde secretary was, thankfully (well, positively in a professional sense) not barefoot and barely able to make eye contact with you. Just how it should be!

"Any messages, Jacinta?" You asked her curtly.

"No, no, Mister James! S-sorry...sorry again about taking off my shoes..." She told you awkwardly, averting her gaze and turning red.

You gave her a casual wave of the hand as you stretched back on your comfy office chair. "Don't sweat it. Just keep those shoes on! Anyway, I've got a few more jobs for you to do..." After instructing Jacinta to do a few - mostly pointless and menial - tasks, you caught up on a few emails. With the time ticking rapidly away, you realised that it was nearly 5pm - time for your cleaning duty to begin.

"Er, Jacinta, I've got to...run an errand..." you announced suddenly while your secretary stared at you with surprise. Deciding it best to be straight with her, as no doubt others would see you cleaning in the office, you explained the cleaning task you had for the next hour - in line with Kim's push for helping the ethnic minority workers of the office.

"Oh, Mister James, that's so...so...kind!" Jacinta said, her voice rising in pitch. She seemed both surprised and curious but did not press you further.

As if on cue, a knock on your office door revealed a glaring Helena, bucket and mop in hand. Without giving you even a thanks, she tossed them to you before strolling away. Typical, such a bitch...

Shrugging it off and taking on your new responsibility in a positive way, knowing that Kim fully approved, you attacked the floors with gusto, determined to get the work done efficiently.

"Wow, I didn't know you were so good at cleaning!"

That familiar voice from behind you stopped you in your tracks. Who was it?
114211221212111111113.title: Go to Kim and tell her that you'll help wit...

choices: You told Michelle and Helena that it was a no go!
Back to your office - time to get Jacinta fired!
11421122121211111112.content:
Just the thought of picking up that damned mop again...making coffee for that idiot Helena every single morning...no you could not bring yourself demean yourself to that; it would spell the end for you! So, that meant no choice but to have her as your secretary...

"OK...OK, option...two..." you muttered through gritted teeth, much to the delight of Michelle and Helena.

"Oooh! You mean you want Helena to be your new secretary?" Michelle beamed while Helena excitedly wiggled her toes, apparently oblivious to the fact that you could not help but admire them.

Well, that wasn't what you wanted at all, but it was the lesser of two evils. "Yes, I want her - you, Helena - to be my...secretary." At least this way you could ridicule and torment the idiot. You would be HER boss, yes...the more you thought about it, the more you realised that by seemingly helping out her new-found friend, Michelle had in fact thrown her to the wolves...

"Excellent! So, you'll have some work to do, right Jeff?" Michelle smirked at you. "Tell, like, whoever your secretary is to pack her bags....oh and tell the boss that you want a different secretary..."

Like you weren't aware! Incredibly, despite your seniority to the brat, you actually found yourself seeking some advice from her. "Er, what should I...what can I tell Kim? I mean, I've had Jacinta for less than a day..."

The look on Michelle's face was a mixture of smugness and scorn. "What, are you, like, retarded? Isn't it obvious, John? Just tell her some shit about Jacin...whatever-her-name-is and show how forward thinking you are - giving a poor, hardworking single Mom an opportunity. Someone who's dedicated their life to the company finally getting a chance to prove themselves. C'mon - it's not that fucking hard!"

Helena chuckled, giving you a patronising look as though it were obvious and that you were a simpleton for having to ask Michelle to spell it out for you.

"OK, sure, right," you babbled, feeling your cheeks redden with how effortlessly the gorgeous intern was verbally dominating you. "I'll get to it..."

Staring at you as you turned awkwardly away, shaking their heads a little with laughter, the two women stayed exactly where they were. Forcing yourself not to take a backward glance at their attractive, teasing bare feet, you decided to head to Kim's office first. Best to approach the boss rather than risk Jacinta crying foul play for an unfair dismissal.

Knocking on Kim's door, a curt 'come in!' was followed by a frown and an impatient sigh from the redhead. "James...twice in one day. What is it now?" Kim took off her spectacles and abruptly stopped typing at her keyboard.

Standing in front of her, heart racing, you were at least revealed to see that she had put her pumps back on! "Er, it's my secretary."

"What about her?" Kim practically growled, clearly wanting you to spit out whatever the issue was. "Is it about her being barefoot? Another foot-related issue in the work place?" She gave you a sardonic smile.

"Er, no she's fine. It's actually that I was thinking about that 'minorities in the workplace' drive - you know, the one in the meeting last week. About opportunities for all."

"Yes, I am aware of that initiative," Kim spoke slowly, eyeing you carefully and shrewdly. "You've found someone to be your secretary, haven't you?"

"Actually, yeah, well that's-"

"James, I commend you for your proactiveness with this particular issue but that's impossible. Jacinta has only been appointed today. It would take a case of gross misconduct to dismiss her during this probationary period," the redhead told you matter-of-factly.

Feeling stupid for forgetting something so simple, you smiled at her. "Oh, it was just a question. No problem - I'll see you later!" Hastily exiting your boss's office before she could further question you, you felt a nasty feeling swirl inside you. What were you to do? The only way of getting rid of Jacinta would be finding a reason to condemn her conduct - that would not be easy of course. Then again, perhaps it was better just to explain to Michelle and Helena that the janitor becoming your new secretary was not a possibility?

Taking a breath, you quickly made your decision...
11421122121211111112.title: Helena - your new secretary?

choices: You agreed to see her later
You blew her off!
114211221212111111122.content:
Almost in a trance, you headed immediately back to your office, relieved (although admittedly, slightly disappointed) to see that Jacinta's open-toed heels were firmly still on her feet. Better that those shoes stay on!

"Mister James," Jacinta babbled, standing up and pointing over to some files. "I-I've done the alphabeticalised system...I've also sorted out those other files you told me about...I..."

"Sure," you told her, distractedly. You had accepted that you were Michelle's plaything, that you were totally at her beck and call. If that meant throwing Jacinta under the bus, so you could satisfy her idea of Helena becoming your secretary, then so be it! You had stepped on people before, figuratively speaking of course. The blonde babbling before you would just be the latest in a long line... Yet, having already spoken to Kim, it would deeply suspicious if you somehow managed to set Jacinta up....

"Mister James...is that...OK?" She practically gulped, staring wide-eyed at you, chewing her lip nervously.

The idea popped into your head at once. It made total sense to play on Jacinta's weakness - on her feelings for you! Giving her your best charming smile and earnest eyes, you cleared your throat. "Jacinta, I...I've been unfair to you. How I've treated you today. Truth be told, it's...it's because of the feelings I have for you."

Staring at you, her mouth hanging open slightly, the blonde was at a loss for words. "F-feelings?" She replied softly.

"Yes, Jacinta. I confess!" You suddenly said with passion, looking at her imploringly. "I...I honestly thought that I could do it but I can't...working with you is just too much. Jacinta, I am totally besotted with you. I - I have been for some time. The reason why I've been a jerk today is because...because I was kidding myself that I could be harsh and dismissive, trying to force away the truth - that I am so into you."

Looking so giddy that she might faint, Jacinta stumbled toward you, holding one of your hands and breathing heavily. "James, I...I don't know if you knew...but I - I feel totally the same way..."

You smiled at her, then looked away sadly for a moment.

"What? What is it?" She looked agitated and squeezed your hand even harder.

"It's...well, this is the problem. I want to be with you - it's what I've wanted for a while now. But you as my secretary....I...it's just not a good idea. I suppose I'll have to...resign...stand down. But at least then we can be together!"

The blonde grabbed at the bait, just as you hoped she would. Crying out incredulously, she shook her head from side to side. "No! Mister James...you can't! You've waited for so long for this position...It's...it's not fair for you!" Giving you a determined look, she looked you right in the eye, her pale blue eyes certainly easy to get lost in. "No, I will resign. I'll step down as secretary - it will be my call. You won't have to take any blame...I'll go to Mrs Kim...I'll tell her that I wasn't ready for this and need to go back to my old job...it's fine...she'll understand..."

"You'd do that, for me?" You smiled at her, squeezing her hand tight. "Then we can talk this through properly, tonight for dinner..."

Well, it turned out that she would! Almost immediately, Jacinta made her way to Kim's office and kept completely true to her word. Kim called you on your office phone to alert you, checking of course if there was any foul play going on. Sticking to your seemingly oblivious story, you feigned disappointment, stating to Kim that Jacinta did seem a little out of her depth but was certainly a kind, hardworking colleague.

"So...what you were saying earlier - about the inclusion initiative...it got me thinking," Kim told you over the phone. "It's your call, James, but if we could get a minority into that position then let me know who you've got in mind."

"Er, actually, I was thinking the janitor - Helena. You know she's a single Mom and has been here pretty much her whole working life..."

Miraculously, Kim seemed to love it. What a great story it would be for the company - the Hispanic janitor getting a promotion and being given such an apprenticeship - the new Junior Manager's secretary! And all due to her hard work and loyalty to the company she had diligently served for years.

So it was some degree of pride, initially at least, when you found the Mexican woman having a cigarette break by the side of the car park. "There you are, been looking for you!" You told her cheerily.

Helena breathed smoke in your face, smirking as you spluttered and coughed. "Gringo. You got my job?"

Inwardly seething at how rude and ungrateful she was, you adopted another smile. "Yes, all sorted. The boss says that you can take the rest of the day off and start tomorrow. Before you go, you need to sign a contract in her office and go through some of the necessary formalities-"

"Yeah, yeah, I got it," your new Hispanic secretary interrupted you, blowing more smoke into your face. Giving you a smirk, she levelled you with a cold stare. "You better be nice to me. Real nice to me. Miss Michelle - she my friend. She told me not to take any kinda crap from you."

Gritting your teeth, you tried not to rage at the fact that this woman wasn't on her knees thanking you for the opportunity. "Sure," you said in a friendly tone before turning on your heel and leaving her to it.

Checking your phone, you saw a WhatsApp from who you realised was Jacinta...

James...I still can't believe it! It's all so fast but I know it's the right thing for us. Come over to mine tonight so we can talk properly...and get to know each other properly...

Sighing, you knew that this was the price to pay. It seemed like the most painless way to rid yourself of Jacinta, yet on an out-of-work capacity, it meant having to deal with the aftermath. Blinking at her, you could not believe this girls' gall. In some ways, it was impressive; she couldn't be much older than 20, yet she was ordering you around so easily, so effortlessly. Coupled with the fact that she was barefoot, you felt yourself literally bending to her will.

Taking a seat opposite her, you took a breath before speaking. "OK....what do you want to know?"

Michelle smirked at you, her cute nose wrinkling as she contemplated you. "Man, you're easy to order around, John. Anyway, I want to know about a few people at this crappy organisation. I want to make sure that I have them, like, totally doing what I want them to - like you!" Giggling for a moment, she wiggled her toenails. "So, I want to know about those two receptionists. One went home earlier..." She frowned for a moment, while you steadied your face to avoid betraying any information about what you did to Candice this morning. "And the cleaner - I've learned from Daddy that you need to know enough even about the little people! Most of all though, I want, like, ALL of the info and goss on the boss - Kim."

"K-Kim? The boss?" You gulped at her, knowing that this sounded like a dangerous game for you to be involved in.

"Uh, yeah. What, are you struggling to keep up with me. Sorry, John. Yeeeesss....I....said.....Kim.....the....boss!" The brunette giggled again, clearly enjoying watching you squirm as you kept quiet and accepted the fact that you simply couldn't rise to any bait from her.

A few moments later, with your eyes now shifting downwards and focusing on her bare feet, her red toenails sparkling a little, you merely nodded in affirmation. Michelle seemed to enjoy this too!

"Good boy," she chuckled. "You're just such a good little pet. That's right - just nod, stare at my feet, and you'll do your own little part in making me a total success."

Nodding again, you found yourself still staring at the intern's feet, almost in a trance like state. Michelle resumed some instructions for you while you continued to stare, pretty much oblivious to whatever she was saying at this point. Yet, she did seem to enjoy the fact that you were averting eye contact now, almost as if in a sign of submission - of a weaker animal avoiding the gaze of a stronger predator! However, staring at her gorgeous feet meant you were missing out on key information that you probably needed to know!

What did you do - continued to stare at her feet and figure out later her instructions, or wrench your head upwards so you could actually focus on what she was telling you?

Fighting your baser urges, you manage to pull your eyes off of Michelle's feet. You look back up to her face to see her grinning ear to ear. "Oh, I see you're finally ready to pay attention, my little pet. Good. You'll have plenty of time to stare at your master's feet after I run this place."

Get me something I can hold over her head, like finding out that she used to be a hooker before coming here or that she has a bastard kid at home. Better yet, get me something that I can use to make her want to obey me, like finding out she's a total nympho, or that she has some sort of fetish I can exploit. Ooo, try for a foot fetish. Foot lovers always break down to me." She taunts with another toe wiggle.

Shit, did she know?! Just play it cool for now. "Yes ma'am. I'll go do that." You quickly exit the break room and sigh to yourself.

You couldn't believe this. Now because of your big mouth, you have to betray the only person here that you consider a friend. What's worse is that it turns out Michelle knew about your fetish all along. She knew how she makes you feel and still makes you do all this demeaning grunt work in some vain effort to please her. What kind of cold-hearted bastard would...


Oooohhh shit. You mentally facepalm as Jacinta begins to flash through your mind, as well as what an asshole you've been to her. Maybe you should go see her.

Although the right thing to do would be to apologise to Jacinta, considering how much of an asshole you've been to her, that thought is fairly fleeting. No, you have much bigger priorities right now than to bother with your hopeless secretary. She would be absolutely fine, you told yourself.

The way Michelle spoke to you was so dismissive, so assertive, so...impressive. You had to admit it - the bratty intern had you EXACTLY where she wanted you! Whether she knew about your foot fetish or not was irrelevant at this point, you realised; she had you bending and scraping before her. Remembering your task, you groaned inwardly.

Jenny...

The redhead receptionist was not only your friend but your ally. Betraying her trust to Michelle would surely cost you that relationship but what choice did you have?! Swallowing thickly and heading towards reception, you tried not to think too much about Michelle's bare feet, how perfectly soft and silky smooth they were...grudgingly, you mentally accepted that you would be masturbating to the thought and smell of her soles and toes later on!

"James! Here he is...our new Junior Manager..." Jenny called over to you, grinning as you approached. "Twice in one day; what do I owe this pleasure?"

"Uh, hi Jenny..." You paused, searching for an idea. To be fair, you knew very little about your friend's private life. You knew that she was single, was generally effective at her job, liked Game of Thrones and rock music...but she had never given you anything that be considered 'dirt'...

"What's up?" Jenny frowned at you. "Aren't you supposed to chastise me and explain how it's 'Mister James'? And shouldn't you be gloating still about the fact that poor old Candice hasn't come back to work?"

Those personal victories and gentle ribbing of your new promotion would normally make you swell with pride and exchange some banter with the redhead. Yet, all you could feel was an uneasiness in your gut. You couldn't be the confident, cocky braggart anymore. Not now that you were Michelle's pet. Your boss, Kim, had even told you to do everything the arrogant newbie instructed you to. Of course, with her being barefoot around you, you felt pretty helpless anyway...

"James? Seriously what is it?" Jenny was now looking more concerned than exasperated. "Is it Denise? I know she's been on the warpath ever since the...incident...with Candice earlier." Your friend smiled for a moment. "But what's new, hey?!"

"Warpath...?" You gulped a little. Normally, the idea of Denise wanting to get one over on you was something to relish - a challenge where you knew that you could outsmart and outthink her. Since you've been humbled thoroughly by Michelle and agreed to do her bidding, for the sake of your own career, you felt overawed and full of trepidation.

"Well, you know... You and Denise....there's always been a rivalry, a competition between you two. Yeah, I know you're a high-flying manager now, but..." Jenny leans in a little closer, as though confiding in you. "She knows, James. She knows that you spilt the coffee on purpose..."

This was not going well at all! The whole point of coming over to Jenny's desk at reception was to get some dirt on her, not feel worried about what Denise was going to do to you! In your peripheral vision, you saw a slender figure with dark blonde hair heading towards you.

"Oh, here she is..." Jenny says, her eyes flashing excitedly, clearly ready and eager to see a verbal back-and-forth between the two of you.

Would you have the stones to deal with Denise right now? If you were quick, you could make a very hasty exit and avoid your nemesis!

Well, that didn't quite matter right now, you were quite irritated right now... yet you felt a bit of a tingling sensation. That intern, how was her name... Michelle! Ah, yes! She was rather beautiful and not to mention that with the addition of those bare feet, she was irresistible...
